reviews.review:
Dishes in order of awesome:

1. pad kee mao with pork- spicy (although only a 5) with plenty of veggies. Weird to have lettuce underneath though. Pretty darn awesome.
2. pineapple fried rice- addictive!
3. pad thai- a tad sweet but still tasty
4. house curry- not as rich as other curries but still alright

Large portions, good service, reasonable prices. I'd come again.

We order takeout from Archi's almost weekly. We love the crispy fried wontons, tom kha soup, pad thai, and yellow curry. We get the 6 spicy rating and it is perfect! I highly recommend this place for great Thai food!

Archis has vindicated themselves. Today was a 180 degree turn around across the board. I guess last time they had an off night. My pops had the pad thai very tasty,solid. I had the silver noodle soup with pork to start...the ingredients so fresh and tasty seriously one of the best soups I have ever had..anywhere! I had the yellow curry with chicken also excellent. I asked for 3 on the heat and omg it was spicey lol..be careful what level you ask for....service was outstanding and pleasant. It is always a pleasure to write a great review....if they deserve it they get it and this place definitely showed that my first visit was a flook...without a doubt will return to this restaurant.

Was late from my work today due to stupidity of the waitress in Archi's Thai Restaurant. Stop by today and order food to go at 11:14am. Ill keep asking the waitress every 30 mins where's my order & waiting for almost 1hour & 30mins. Just find out that they forgot my order & missed up. Not even apologizing there mistake from the start & never even offer any discount or even just a decent apology for there mistake. Im not happy. I'm very disappointed and upset!!! Sad to say...been spending a lot of money here for almost 6times every month to dine-in with friends & take out order. This is was a worst experience I had with this restaurant. Never come back here again!

My experience of Archie's from another location was notably better than this location. I may be trippin', but I don't think so either. 

Panang chicken curry- 4 stars. The other location was a definitive 5 stars. 
Curry fried rice w/ pork- 3 stars. The other location was also a definite 5-stars. 
Stuffed chicken wings- 3 stars. It was good. 

I'll be heading over to the other location to get my Archie's grub on. But, I'd say it is one of the best Thai food in town from my experience at other location.
It's my favorite restaurant. Great food, excellent selection and great service. My favorite dishes are num tok beef and pad see-ew w/ chicken. I highly recommend this place

Pyaar Indian Restaurant a few stores down...Y U WEBSITE SAY U HAVE BUFFET MONDAY BUT U NO OPEN MONDAY?!?!

Maybe it was for the best...Original plan was to hit up Pyaar for indian buffet and get some spice and flavor on. Too bad it was closed but this couldnt have worked out better as a vast majority of people leaving their parked cars were migrating toward Archi's.

Shapow man ordered a beef salad which came real quick. My red curry lunch special took it's sweet time but what lacked in readily available made up in mmmm mmmm good.

The soup that is included with the lunch special was kind of a thai american fusion. It was chicken soup but was thickened and egg dropped. Thick cuts of onion, carrot slivers, and celery with decent sized slices of chicken white meat.

I was overall impressed with the red curry. Medium wasnt quite as spicy as i was expecting ordering a medium but it had a very pleasant creaminess from the coconut milk. Lots of bamboo shoots which i love. Salad was perfectly dressed with a thickened fish sauce (i think) based dressing. Overall everything on that plate was friggin good.

Total damage done between an order of the red curry lunch special, a beef salad, and a cranberry juice: 21.49

Wait....what? the total damage rung up to twenty one fiddy?? Oh hells no i'm bout to come back a few more times.

We are frequent diners at both of Archi's locations. We use this one if we plan on seeing a movie. 

Our experience today will make us never come to this location again. We were seated promptly in their new section against the windows. We waited for 5 minutes before someone even approached out table. We ordered drinks and waited to have someone take our food order. Another 5 minutes. We didn't get anything crazy - 1 order of Thai egg rolls and 2 plates of Pad Thai. This took a little longer than usual but they were busy so it was understandable. However, we were only approached once for a refill and that's it. 

When I say that's it, I mean WE HAD NO MORE SERVICE. No one came to check on us again, no one asked if we needed to go boxes, no one asked if we were done and ready for our check. I tried flagging down our waitress since we were trying to get to our movie to no avail. Finally, my boyfriend left to purchase our tickets thinking I would be ready to go by the time he got back. Nope. He actually had to ask for our check and a box at the hostess stand. What a horrible experience. I felt bad for the people who got seated 2 tables down from us who had to wait 15 minutes to be approached. However, the people who came in 10 minutes after us and ordered, ate, and left 10 minutes before us (ordering more food AND getting refills and checked up on) maybe you could give the rest of us some advice on how to handle this place.

Ordered Phad Thai, Pad See ew, Beef Panang and Papaya salad. Papaya salad came in first and it was delish and while enjoying eating it, guess what, it has hair. I told the waitress they apologize and gave us a new one. Phad Thai came and it has no peanuts and just ok. Pad see ew was overcooked. Beef panang is not that bad but just ok.

I love how there food is authentic. I always order extra peanut sauce.& Thai tea! :)
My experiences with takeout and din in are always awesome!

Ohhhh man this place was so good! I've taken take out before but couldn't remember how it was. We ordered the pineapple fried rice and this was the BEST! Definitely a must order. The size is pretty big I was surprised, enough for 2 people. Also ordered the pad see eww and it was good. Not the best I've tried but not the worst. Overall price, quality and amount of food is great!

I just ordered takeout from Archi's and the food is amazing! I ordered the Green Curry with Beef (medium) and the Penang with Chicken (medium) and they're both delicious. Both were $9.95 each. It's exactly how spicy I wanted it to be. I've been looking for a really good Thai restaurant since I moved here and thankfully I've found it. The host was friendly and the place was clean. They deserve 5 stars!
By far the best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas.  We drive across the city just for their food!!!! I highly recommend!!!!!

So my I brought my folks here for a post-Christmas dinner. I ordered my favorite pineapple rice. Not only did they make it spicy, I found a strand of hair! So the server made us a new one. But it was still spicy. I have brought my guests and friends here many times but this experience ruined it. Makes me wonder how sanitary they are in the kitchen.

We can't get enough of this place!  It is the BEST Thai food in Las Vegas hands down.  You MUST try the Pad Kee Mao, nobody makes it better.  Their Thai Tea is also the best you will find in town.  Highly recommend!!!!!

Friend and I ate here for lunch on a weekend in June.  I had the pad thai which I usually get at a Thai restaurant I've never been to before since pad thai is my benchmark of the eatery's cooking.  It was ok.  Restaurant decor was nice and service friendly.  

This was the second Archi's restaurant I've tried and I think I'll stick with the single store, mom & pop Thai eateries.  Actually, we only ate at this Archi's because the line to Bachi Burger was too long.  I would rate this Archi's 4-stars had I been there for a weekday lunch special.  As it was, with it's weekend menu pricing, the place was ok.

Food is ridiculously great! We ordered Spicy Basil (spicy level 3 is perfect, it's spicy enough that you can still taste the flavor) and the Panang (it is curry with a pinch of awesomeness).

This location, W Sahara and Ft Apache, is good if you are not in a rush. The staff is friendly but you will have to wait alot to get your drinks, to order your food, to get your food, to get your bill.... So on, you get the picture. This is why I give them a 4 stars.

Otherwise, the food is amaaaaazing and it is perfect location for a date nite (right next door to a theater!).

Kept hearing from everyone that Archi's is awesome.  Overrated in my opinion.  You sink in the chairs and feel like a child in a high chair and I'm a very tall person.  Food was not as good as my favorite Thai place - Thai style noodle house, and was more expensive.  Won't be returning.  Nothing stood out.

Great Chicken Pad Thai and Pad See Ew!

Every other dish I have gotten here has been good as well including soups and appetizers. 

Great service too. Very fast and friendly.
The best green chicken curry ever! I recently found out about this place and have been going about twice a week Definitely my new addiction

Hands down a very good place to have lunch.  The food was delicious and hot.  The service was good are cups are always full whenever are drinks are almost halfway.  Price for food is awesome especially for good large portions.  I will come again for lunch or even for dinner no doubt thanks guys.
Worse service ever. The tables around us were all complaining so this isn't me being overly picky. Food however was good.

I've heard lots of folks talk about this Thai place called Archie's.  this is my favorite kind of food. I've eaten here 4 times now. Ordered different food each time. I think the food here is good. Good I say, not great. I could not find anything that puts this restaurant above any other Thai restaurant. The price is high for the for the food you get. I recommend it but with a note added that the meals will cost almost double that of other good Thai restaurants.

Yesterday I came in with a friend to try out their fresh spring rolls and peanut sauce. I also ordered Kung Pao Chicken. I was impressed that the food was good and I did not have to wait as long as others. While devouring the spring rolls we were immediately served chicken soup or something like it. It was good. By that time our food was being brought out. I asked for medium by right away I determined I should have asked for HOT. Anyhow, Archi's delivered. Go try it for your self.

I can't believe I haven't written a review for Archi's! 

Archi's is really authentic! I haven't had a bad experience with them. I always order the seafood combo with green curry and their chicken pad thai. I also like their fried rice, spicy eggplant with tofu and seafood tom yum soup! :) i didnt like their thai tea though because it was very sour and bitter. 

Service is excellent and food is really cheap! Come by and check it out!

3 stars only because their food is good. Stopped by with my boyfriend at around 7. The place was full but not super full. We were quickly led to a table in the back corner and given two menus, great! I start looking at the menu but soon notice no one has passed by to ask us for our drink order. I look up at another table that had came in after us and noticed they had already received their drinks. Annoyed with this drink situation, my boyfriend starts looking around and then a male worker comes up to ask us if anyone has taken our drink order. We respond no and he asks us what we want.... okay, everything is fine. While we are at it my boyfriend asks for some crispy wontons..... the waiter says "I'm not your waiter".... ummm k......so he leaves and then two minutes later another girl comes by asking our drink order. We explained someone had stopped by already. This waiter theme continues throughout the night, literally 3-4 different waiters stopped by dropping things off at our table or to ask us something. Also, why is everything placed in the corner far away from the customer? Lol, I don't mind reaching, I just don't understand. In the end, we ate our food, it was great! I just didn't particularly like the service per say.
I have been to every Archi's location in Vegas.  You cannot go wrong with the food.  It is fantastic.  Service is good, but can be a bit unorganized when its busy.  Overall definitely worth going to.

My first time coming here for a friends Bday and to think I've been tolerating and spending my time at Original Thai BBQ and not have known about Archi's this whole time.  Best Thai dish I've had in Vegas and service is great also.

Friend recommended the Chee Choo catfish in curry sauce. Ordered medium spicy which was not at spicy at all but other than that it still had the right touch of flavor and the curry sauce was good. But after trying out my friends spicy beef eggplant, it made me wish I ordered that instead.

Archi's for me always always been my favorite Thai spot in Vegas. I have been a fan ever since there first location on flamingo. Just seeing Archi's grow with two more locations all on my side of town not only makes it more accessible. I love seeing non franchise chains or that small family style run restaurant succeed. The thing about success and growing more restaurants is will the consistency be there at ALL locations. I can honestly say before I tried this location the one on rainbow my go to since closest to home. The food has been just as awesome, amazing, and on point every time. I am huge fan of the lunch specials! I also come lot for dinner with my brother family. I have never had bad dish on the menu. Some of my favorite are the spicy basil, any of the curry, and really can go on and on. Just ry it if never had Archi's. 

This location it right next to the movie theater so makes for perfect before movie or after movie spot. Honestly that shopping center almost ridiculous amount of quality and assortment of food can get not just Thai food. Leave that for another review. Lol! 

Two things that stood out for me came to this location versus the others. I felt like the lunch special portion was twice the size compare the rainbow location. I would order the same thing spicy basil with ground chicken. Swear the spicy basil was twice the size. The plate was full full compare to rainbow location everything looked nicely portion size. Just overflowing almost. Thumbs up for me!!! The dining area might be the same size as rainbow location but feel like bigger again maybe double in size. Fair the set up lot more different. The dining room has high ceilings compare to the rainbow location. Upfront almost like dining room next to dining room. Not as loud so comes lunch time or busy no need to shout out conversations. The tables not literally next to one another then rainbow location. The decor like definitely know walking into Thai restaurant. The service feel like they stop by more often check up on you. I went right around prime lunch hour and not as busy as rainbow location. 

Overall Archi's is my five star Thai hands down. Just happy not only do they have multiple locations but knowing that get the same great food at each one. Five star all on its own. Consistency...

I stopped in for the first time last week for dinner and gave them a 5 star review. Today was lunch with my little one and I have to say the service was subpar. Food was still great so the cooks know what they are doing, but the service not so much.

I ordered the lunch Pad Thai and a side of plain rice noodles for my one and half year old (didn't see any children's menu or offered a separate children's menu). 

Soup it came with was good. They brought out a bowl of rice which I thought came with lunch, and my food a bit later.

No noodles for the baby. Had to ask about 5 minutes into my own meal all the while trying to keep me quiet by giving him the rice which he just threw on the floor.

The baby started to fuss toward the end of the meal so I handed them my CC so we could get out of their quickly. When I got it and bill I noticed they had charged me for the rice, which I never asked for. Not wanting to flag them down and reverse the transaction I signed their copy and made a note on the itemized copy about the overcharge. 

Because this place doesn't seem family friendly I will not be coming here on a regular basis. Maybe once in and blue moon for dinner when we have a sitter, but even that will be rare. In the meantime, I will be looking for another thai place that meets my expectations.

Good Thai food 
Close to the cinemas
Had the tofu Kung post, veg fired rice and Lab chicken salad
All items were good 
Quick service and friendly staff

Spur of the moment lunch time stop turned into restaurant love affair! That's what happened last weekend between Archi's and I. 

What a great find! What I loved immediately about this place was the warm, welcoming interior. I forgot that I was in a huge strip mall somewhere in Vegas.

My cucumber salad was sweet and refreshing and my chicken was delicious. The veggies were fresh and tasty. Our drinks were filled at all times, and we never went without anything we could need or want. 

The prices were fair (really good lunch specials during the week, but we were there on a weekend). 

I think this is standard everywhere, but it still bugged me that we weren't able to just pay a little extra to upgrade to brown rice (we had to get the steamed rice that came with the meals and then pay for a huge side of brown rice). If that's my only real complaint about this terrific restaurant then I know I'll be back (but only when I have to be on this side of town). 

There's something so exciting about stumbling in to a new place and being totally blown away by it. I'll be thinking of this restaurant and that meal for quite some time!

Picked up take out, shrimp fried rice and ongchoi with pork.  Packaged nicely. 

Exactly what I wanted.  Delicious !

The service was horrible and the food was mediocre at best. I waited 25 minutes after ordering for my bland portion of prik king to come out. After eating, it took another 10 minutes for them to actually notice and bring over my bill. Will not be returning.
Just ok.  Nothing special.  Last time I was there was a hair on my plate.  Food is better then other thai places in summerlin.  I'll be back.

My go-to place for days when I can't be bothered to cook dinner and am looking for some real&good Thai food in a comfortable setting. I've come to always gravitate towards the red curry (at least lvl5 heat, because I love myself) and the spicy eggplant. The service has generally been great, and the food consistently hits the spot.

Take-out here is also a great option; they usually take 15-25 minutes to prepare my order after I call in, which gives me enough time for me to make the drive to pick it up. The containers they use are also really convenient for storing any leftovers.

I was referred to this place from the Rocky Fritz store owner and said it's really inexpensive and they tasted good. So why not give it a try since I haven't had a Thai cuisine for 2 years already. I asked the server what can he recommend and he pointed out the Spicy eggplant which I like eggplant also and you can combine with your choice of pork, vegetables or seafood and I chose pork. Hmm for a skinny person like me I ate the whole plate LOL!!! My bf ordered Pad Cha2x and it tasted good also. So far I'm loving this restaurant already and will come back for more.

Beef noodle soup has great broth and is unique in the valley.  It comes with a lot of watercrest, bean sprouts and a lot of beef (brisket, tendon, and slices).  

The curries here are solid.  We generally also order the fish cakes for sharing which comes with a small sweet & sour cucumber salad with peanuts crust on top.  We can't decide which of the two is tastier! 

There are many Thai places in Las Vegas, however the flavors are good here and quality is consistent.

I went there with my boyfriend and my best friend.  I ordered the pad Thai and it was delicious. The portion was huge,  (for only me) so I ate half of it and took the rest home. Prices are very affordable. The  only thing I dislike was how long we waited for the food. They also brought out my friends food first, which left her waiting another 10 mins or so until our food got there. I really liked it but it didn't surpass my expectations. The service was just okay, not too much attention was given like other restaurants. I will most likely visit again but Pin Kaow is still my favorite Thai restaurant. I would give it 3.5 stars!

So Archi's turned out to be a hidden gem after going there for the first time, I thought the food was decent but not spicy as I had ordered. I LOVE spicy food- the hotter, the better. I know most people think they like spicy food and when you give them a mildly hot dish they start crying like a baby. Which is why I always order my dishes at the highest spice level a restaurant serves. And so, my first visit to Archi's I did as such and was disappointed by the lack of heat. I mentally crossed them off my checklist of my favorite Thai spots....  A month later I was craving Thai and Archi's is literally a block from my house so I gave them another try. After the first 5 bites of food, I was breathing FIRE!! I couldn't believe the extreme turn around of spiciness level and I absolutely loved it! 

Archi's has now become one of my top favorite Thai places and I know I can count on them to live up to my expectations. I work in a smoky bar and when I get home from work I usually feel sick to my stomach from breathing in second-hand smoke all day. The Tom Yum with chicken (level 10) always does the trick to make me feel better or cure a hangover. I also LOVE the Pad Pak w/chicken (lot's of delicious veggies with choice of meat), Garlic Pepper Chicken, and Red Curry. The only think I don't care for is the Pad Thai at this place. It's reddish orange for some reason....??

Food is always good but service is not good. They've expanded the place but it made service worse. A lot of empty tables but a line at the door with one guy working register, seating people and acting as a waiter too!!! Normally I would get up and leave but food is good
All said and done I'll still come back
Adios
Dinner review only.  The red curry is very good! But the portions were small and I felt like the amount of rice was too small.  I prefer pin kaow.

I have driven past this place for awhile now and finally decided to stop in, WHOA I have been missing out, this place is awesome.  We were greeted immediately and given a nice booth. Our server was prompt, courteous and very informative. We loved the food and will be back for sure

Good Food best thai food i town. 

The only thing that we dont like about this place is when we come here around 9pm they start cleaning and mopping flor. Which is kinda rude and the smells of clorine is bad!

A friend recommended this place to me because I could not find any Thai restaurants that can actually make Thai hot food.  This location has a scale of 1 to 10 but they have a secret scale you can go 1 to 30 on the Hot scale and now I have a new favorite Thai restaurant I will definitely keep coming back

This Thai restaurant is quite a ways from the Strip.  We had went to another restaurat before Archi's, but that restaurant had too long a waiting time.  So we decided to try this place instead.  Fortunately, we had no wait time.  There was one table just waiting for our party of 4.  The ambiance was relaxing, and the restaurant was nicely decorated.  Staff was attentive without being intrusive, and the food came out quickly.

So, this is what we ordered and shared.  Beef Pad see ew for $8.95, ginger ginger ginger chicken for $9.95, spicy chicken basil fried rice for $9.95, green curry chicken for $9.95, and Thai iced tea for $3.95.  Everything tasted fine.  Not outstanding, but above average.  

Las Vegas has so many restaurants to choose from.  If I was in the area craving Thai food, I would certainly drop by here again.  If I was not in the area, then I would not come all the way here to eat.

Overall though, Archi's Thai Cafe is a good spot to eat.  If they were in my hometown, I'd rate them 4 stars.  In Vegas, though, because of all the choices out there....I can only give them 3 stars.

My fiancé and I went to Archi's when the kid was in school. We asked for the Pork Pad Thai. We also ordered the chicken panang and they both were a delight. 
The restaurant was pretty comfortable spacious unlike many Thai bistros or restaurants. I appreciated the decor it was very nice inside. I gave it a four because they were not busy at all on our waitress was not really on top of our drinks. It was a warm day and spicy food ='s Need for water and Tea. After our meal we had some scrumptious Coconut ice cream after our meal and it helped cool us off. Being that the place is one block from our home it will be a new spot for me and my girl.
I posted a menu link for this Thai restaurant. Hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Definitely deserves a 5 star rating! My friends and I have been coming to the Archi's Thai Cafes for a few years now and we always order BIG family style! If you're lucky to get Pete at one of the Archi's, he's a real cool guy! We used to order the Catfish Delight until Pete highly recommended the Choo Chee Catfish at #3! Soo good! The mood is right for casual dining or if you'd like to have a good quiet dinner with a special person ;) Our friend is Thai and they said it's one of the best they've ever tasted!


Our usual order looks something like this: Tom Kha soup, Choo Chee catfish, Pad Kee Maw, Lard Na, Eggplant beef, and LOTS of steamed rice! Hope you're prepared for some knockout food! Sawadee ka and bon appétite! (dang, three different languages?!)
Always great food and people here....lotta people here for lunch...we love the chicken satay and Pad Thai combination house special.
Great service, ambiance, food, and the lunch menu is so affordable!  $7.95 for a half serving of entree, salad, egg roll, and house soup. I always have to pack mine up.

My wife and I ordered Pad Kae Mao (drunken noodles) Spicy Level 6 and Spicy Basil with Pork Spicy Level 7. 

The restaurant has a nice and open layout. A good amount of space between tables. The waitress and servers were nice and attentive.

- the drunken noodles was delicious. I usually order this in most Thai restaurants and this is probably the best I have had in Vegas (so far). I personally don't like Thai food that is towards the sweet side, and this was definitely very savory with a nice light basil flavor. There were lots of vegetables like mushrooms, baby corn, and green beans. The spice level was up there, so if you don't like spicy food, I recommend ordering much below a 6.

- spicy basil with pork was an above average dish. It came with a tiny bowl of rice. With all of the sauce, I was hoping there would be more rice. The dish comes with ground meat, and we requested sliced pork instead and they accommodated us without any problems. There is a soy sauce, basil, stir fry flavor. I would probably try something else off the menu next time.

All in all - good place to eat with a convenient location next to the movie theater.

Best Tai food in the area. They get busy but it's worth the wait. Order to go and it's fantastic too. The environment is ok, a little crowded but not too loud. Chicken Satay is the best, next level delicious. Great! I could eat here everyday.
Great for take out! Just remember they are closed on Tuesday. Beef salad is amazing - choose a 5. Just the right amount of heat.

Hands down, one of my favorite Thai spots to eat.  I LOVE the thai beef jerky, nobody makes it like them.  I also love the pad thai, and the pad woon sen.  When someone says 'thai food', my brain immediately thinks about whether or not this place is open right then.

AWESOME thai tea. Love their ginger dishes. This place was really good, and service is always quick and friendly. Definitely a new favorite spot. I have been here about 3-4 times in the past month already!

Consistent. Love coming here for casual dining. Very clean, friendly. The food is spot on. 
This time around had the ginger, ginger beef and curry pandang wit chicken. It was delicious. 
Great Thai food!

Can't go wrong with the pinapple currie! I never skip it when I go here. I love the environment and the service is attentive, even though some can be stingy sometimes. The prices are on the high side. Have had desert here too and its really good. Great thai food altogether.

2 visits, 2 stars.  OK, so for the good and the not-so-good:

I had eaten here for a late lunch and had the Tom Yum / Shrimp Seafood soup and hot tea.  I liked that you can control the spice level of the soup from 1 - 10.  The soup tasted very good, and very fresh too.  I left feeling very satisfied.  And, I liked the decorum and presentation of the place.  Its location is very convenient, near Summerlin right by the movie theater.

I liked this place enough, that I decided to head back several days later for another lunch.  I wanted to try one of their salads.  

Before I ordered, I went to the restroom.  A worker from the kitchen was using the restroom at the same time, and I noticed that he did not  seem to wash his hands after.   While it is possible he might have washed his hands in the kitchen after he left, it is certainly not something I wish to speculate about nor think about when eating.  

I would have said something to the waitress, but she was busy. I ended up leaving without ordering anything, and it is highly unlikely I will ever return.

let's be honest. the food is great here. The service? friggin sucks big one. they are so rude. I think our waitress forgot to put one of the dishes in. our crab fried rice came out when we were almost done with our meal. than she told us that crab fried rice takes longer than any other dishes to prepare. wtf? she must thought we were stupid. as i said, go there for food but don't expect good service. tall nerdy looking guy with glasses seem like he didn't care when I complained. PinKow is just as good and I always get good service there.
Delicious! I went here 4 times in 1 week. LOL...can't get enough of their curries.

So, i love the food. Its the best Thai restaurant I've been to EVER...butttttt recently the service there has been very poor over the past couple of months. the last two times I've ordered take-out, both orders were completely wrong and I've had them read it back to me as well to make sure we were on the same page. Apparently, i need to take out my entire meal from now on in the shop to make sure I've gotten what I wanted correctly....

I love Thai Food. Like, a lot. And I'm super picky about my Thai. I moved to vegas about a year ago and tried a few places. They were all ok but none were really amazing that i had to go back. Then someone recommended Archi's. Since I'm giving it 5 stars (which honestly may not be enough stars), you can probably assume I love this place and go often. I have finally found my Vegas thai restaurant and will continue to go back. Pretty great deal on the lunch special with large portions. Can't go wrong.

Archi's is my go to Thai place in Vegas! Anything you get here is going to be delicious, no lie. Some of my favorites are..

Panang Curry - I would definitely recommend this dish with tofu, it literally will melt in your mouth. The tofu is slightly fried so the outside has some texture and it is served over white rice. Sadly brown rice is an extra $2. 

Pad Kea Mow - This dish is so satisfying and delicious. Best Pad Kea Mow I have ever had.

Tom Yum Soup - Sometime I will get this as an light appetizer before my main entree, but  be careful they make this REALLY spicy so get a low number for spice.

Pad Thai - always a winner.

I also really like the red and green curries, pineapple fried rice, pad prik king, spicy basil and rad nar. 

The service here is usually pretty good and the servers are attentive. The prices are reasonable and the food is always delicious. I can't get enough Archi's :)

I love Archi's.  While it's not the place I go most often for Thai food, it's the place I go when I want a decent assortment of dishes on the menu and Thai food prepared consistently well.  There's enough variety there to satisfy what you're looking for most of the time:  appetizers, salads, soups, entrees (including curry and noodle dishes) and desserts.  I've eaten at the W. Sahara restaurant, and Rainbow Blvd. restaurant and found the food and service to be consistently good at both.

Lunch portions are almost as big as the dinner portions and include an egg roll and small soup.  They're definitely worth choosing from during the lunch hour.

Dinner is always delicious.  For those who enjoy Thai food, you'll see many of your usual favorites there.  If you're new to this variety of Asian cuisine, consider adding your choice of meat to the Pad Thai (everyone seems to love this dish), Pad Se Ew, Pad Prik Pow, or Broccoli.    If you're in the mood for curry, there are eight dishes to chose from and they're all good.  If you'd rather go with soup, I highly recommend Tom Yum or Tom Kha.  (Tom Kha is essentially Tom Yum but with coconut milk added to make the soup creamier rather than brothy.)

I prefer the fried Egg Rolls (they're served warm, right out of the fryer) rather than the fresh Spring Rolls (served cold).  And if you've never tried one, don't forget to treat yourself to a Thai Iced Tea.  They're almost too sweet for me, but they still taste fantastic.  It's almost like a liquid dessert.

Finally, like with most Thai restaurants, you can dial the spiciness up or down.  The waitstaff will ask, so go conservative if you're a little nervous and dial up from there.  You'll start to feel the heat with anything above a moderate level, and if you're adventurous, go for "Thai hot".  (But you better like spicy food.)

Parking (at the Sahara location) is ample since the restaurant is located in a storefront.  When you enter the parking lot, look for the Regal Cinema.  Archi's is to the right.

Terrible service... good food. The server took the order and vanished, never brought the requested spice tray nor refilled drinks. I think her name is Dhen. Unfriendly, coarse and unprofessional. But the food is consistently good.

I like Archi's but it's not the best.  It is nice that they opened up a decent Thai Place in Summerlin.  But the selection (veggie), is a bit small and run of the mill.  The atmosphere is nice, the service is good and the food is tasty, but something is just missing.


I will go back because it's close to my parents, but I still prefer lotus of Siam.

Thai food is "hit and miss", and this is a "hit".

This is not exotic, like Lotus of Siam, but it is good, and the portions are generous.

We have compared this place to other Thai places, and also fee that the ingredients are good quality. 

We have tried many of the appetizers and our favorite is the the stuffed wing.

I suggest the Papaya Salad and the Panang Curry with Chicken. I go with a spice level of 5 or 6.

My wife's favorite is the Spicy Basil, spice level 8, but she's Korean.

We have also tried the other noodle dishes, and have been very pleased. 

I give them 4 stars, not 5 because the service is fair at best. You will meet the whole staff being served. One girl will take your order, another will bring you your food, another will refresh your water or iced tea, another will bring you your check. 

Make all your requests at one time, or you may have to hunt down your server.  We find ourselves frequently yelling for a bus boy, which is not considered rude in the Thai Culture. 

This place is located next to a Movie House, so I think it's perfect for Dinner and a Movie!!!

Settibello Pizza, Bachi Burger, 808 Hawaiian Tapas is also here. Skip these places and go to Archi's. Your taste buds and wallet will both thank you!!!

I regularly go with my family and friends to this restaurant only b/c of the food. In the recent times the staff here became a nightmare the serving is horrible, they always mess-up the order and spice level, Zero respect to the customer (They think they are serving the food for free). I go so regularly (Almost every week) but my last visit made me decide never to visit this place again. This restaurant needs a serious discipline I request to the regular customer's to teach them a lesson by avoiding it. The owner of the restaurant has to put lots of effort to improve the behavior of the staff (The basic step welcoming the customers with a smile).

I've eaten here a few times. The food is very good and the service is ok. The lunch specials are priced great. I do feel that they can turn it up and do much better with the service. The friendliness of the staff lacks genuine feelings.

On the last visit I ordered a cola to be served a can of cola and glass of ice. Really? No soda fountain! No fresh brewed tea? Ok so the food is good but they also deliver it at very spaced and awkward timing so not all parties receive their food at the same time.

Decent Thai food, but didn't quite blow me away. True to what others have said, they really do make "spicy" spicy. I ordered the tong yum soup and the red curry, both at medium spicy level, and both were indeed quite spicy (I am also a fan of spiciness). They were generous with with the seafood in the tong yum, and the curry was solid. Portions are also very generous. I"m not from the area, so I can't comment on how it compares to other places in Summerlin, but it's decently good in my opinion.

Fine, Archi's....you win! 

The Tom Kha soup here is soooo delicious, I start salivating (and sweating) just thinking about it! Coconut milk mixed with an abundance of spices like lemon-grass and basil...and cute button mushrooms....ugh, I want some right now! I get it with level 3 spicy and it's perfect. 

They have a pretty complete menu of authentic Thai food here, and you can order Pad Thai noodles with varying degrees of spiciness (from 1-10). Pad thai is nothing special, and I've tried the Rad Na noodles as well, which was a little too saucy for me. Overall, noodles are like 3 star quality. 

Also, if you order the Thai Iced Tea, get ready for a HUGE glass of tea :D  It's a little sweet for my liking, but they are very generous with portion size!

There food is great but organization is a total shit show. They have no idea who is waiting and or who has to be seated. Sad because this was really close to my workplace. I'll continue to go to the rainbow location but this location sucks!

This place is goooood. I came with a friend for dinner, and he ordered a pad thai while I chose the pineapple fried rice. The food was served quickly and the ingredients are fresh, and the prices are reasonable.

Inside it appears somewhat small, but the decor is very well laid out and there's a lot of open space. The nighttime dining atmosphere is well-lit to ensure you don't accidentally jam food up your nose instead of into your mouth.

There's not much service here, all they do is refill your water and hand you the bill, but it's likely the quality of the food will make you forgive them for the crappy service.

I have been a fan of this place for about 4 years. I finally got my husband to eat here and he is hooked! We both love the pad Thai which is super yummy. I also really like the Yellow curry with sticky rice. If you enjoy spicy foods this is your place cause they don't mess around when it comes to spicy!
Great lunch specials. Nice location. Red curry is tasty good, Thai-Tea is classic.

When I first walked into this place, the atmosphere felt warming and it looked very authentic. Normally when I go to a Thai restaurant, I usually order pad Thai. The pad Thai tasted so delicious. The portion was just right, the spice level was on point also. The staff was also very kind and helpful.

Omg the food is so good! I only come here once every couple of months because my roommate and I are VERY fond of the Thai beef salad and its a little on the expensive side (about $40 for two including the Thai iced tea). Its totally worth it though. The shaved papaya is so fresh, meat juicy, and veggies crisp. Be careful with the heat though. I eat a lot of Thai food and judging how hot these places make your food is hard. I ordered the 5 my first time here and nearly choked it was so hot. The 3 was a little cooler but still spicy. This time I ordered the 2 and it was perfect. This place tends to ALWAYS be crowded. Its best to call in your order and then pick up. I made the mistake of just dropping by and had to wait in a line almost out to the parking area.

I love thai food and usually stick with Pin Kaow 3, but I had spotted Archi's Thai Cafe (during multiple trips to Bachi Burger...shh don't judge) and made a mental note to try it soon.

I'm glad I did! Came here for a late lunch with friends. There were a handful of other people in the restaurant. Service was ok, the waitresses were mostly attentive but there were long gaps between water refills. Other than that, the waitresses were nice.

What really made me happy I tried Archi's Cafe was that their spice level is actually SPICY! Their scale is 1-10 (like Pin Kaow and other thai restaurants) but ordering a 9 here, felt like a real level 9! 

It was spicy, my lips were on fire halfway through my plate of veggie pad thai and I was in heaven. I consistently order spicy level 10 at other thai restaurants and it's hot but not truly spicy. Archi's did that for me.

Service is the pits. Get ready to settle in. We waited a hour for a take out order that had 3 appetizers, 3 entrees, and a soup. The Tom Yum Chicken soup was delicious, but everything else was just okay. Other places do it just as well, in a timely manner.

A co-worker and Yelp coaxed me in to trying this place and it did not disappoint.  I came specifically for the Tom Yum Chicken and it was quite delicious! (I'd have given it a 5, but I've never had Thai before so there was nothing to compare it to.)
I ordered to-go...the cashier was very pleasant...and my order arrived quickly.
I'll definitely be back!

love Thai food.  we tried this place one random night the husband was away for work.  las vegas is a large grid.  so going down one main exit street could take hours to find the end.  we just moved here so we drove down 215 and found an exit to travel down one such street and chance stumbling upon a restaraunt we wanted to eat at.  

again, the streets can go on forever as ever.  we were almost to
our own street [buffalo] so we had to decide fast.. 

we came upon a plaza that had a jollie bee, a fancy shmancy, a couple other things... and archi's thai cafe.   though I told the kids they could pick what they wanted, I came out the winner in this game.  again, I love Thai food.

theirs lots of parking.. 

the decor is very traditional thai and is a really good sized restaurant with lots of seating.  our waitress was friendly and though it was busy.. she never forgot about us.

the order:

appetizer- stuffed chicken..  [wow]  the kids loved it..  my son, who doesn't often venture from the norm,  loved  this dish a lot.  super good..

i had my usual yellow chicken curry mildly spiced and i they had an excellent curry..

won ton soup- the won tons were juicy and the broth flavorful.. the vegetables and slices meat slices were plentiful.  it definitely did not disappoint.

shrimp fried rice- comes with a lot!  it's tasty.

after trying archis for the first time..  i'm a fan!
will definitely try the one closer to our house.. not sure when i'll ever see this particular location again.. but if i were closer i'd probably be a regular!

Got here to The Sahara location at 9:28 and they are already cleaning up and the guy In the front says were only doing take outs. REALLY it's 30 mins until you close. Not 30 min until you lock the door and leave. I really hate placed that are in such a damn hurry to get out and close. I assure you the Owner of the company isn't there it's just the lazy workers who want to go home as early as possible.  I come here a couple times a month and have never experienced this.  Might not come back.

I loved Archi's on Sahara and was so bummed I would no longer be able to eat its yummy dishes when I moved back to NY.  I am in love with their stuffed chicken wings and their curries. All colors and flavors of curry are delicious.  Their noodle dishes are also quite good and soups. No dish has been disliked by me yet. 

One bad thing is they are not open late. They're only open til 10p and for late night diners, this sucks. There are three locations which is a good thing though.

Best pad see ew and mint leaf/basil fried rice in town. However the pad thai is not nearly as good as in Pin Kaow by a long shot. Overall one of the better Thai restaurants in Las Vegas. It is clean and easy to find and very convenient if you live in or near Summerlin. 

One area of constructive criticism since I do eat here often with the family: I would say is the customer service needs to be improved drastically since this is the only area that has a lot of room for improvement since their food is very good. It is not bad by any means, but they often appear disorganized. Some servers are better than others. Specifically, when lines start to form the given estimated times are more like guesses and substantially differ depending on who passing by at the front. It appears that having a hostess at the front at all times (during the peak times) would be a quick fix.

We've been going to the Archi's locations for awhile a couple years now and like in any location that we go to, I usually stick to our "usual" (Tom You Shrimp w/ white rice & calamari) because I have a fear called-- disappointment and I hate it. But I've been trying to get over my fears and one day we decided to venture outside of the usual. Our newest discovery was the Papaya Salad. Shredded Papaya with a sweet chili flavor type sauce and leaves of lettuce. My husband loves spicy food, so he gets (from a scale of 1-10) a 6, as for me, I am a fricking wimp when it comes to heat in my food so, I usually have a few bites and eat the crap out of the lettuce since it's mostly water and it's super refreshing! 

Other than the Papaya Salad, the food is like any other Thai restaurant and can assist with any fix that you're looking to get for Thai food. The thing that differentiates Archi's from other Thai restaurant is the fact that they pay attention to detail through service and presentation. Pure white plates and carved garnishes are usually small indicators that they care about- presentation. The decor of the restaurant is very modernized. Walking towards Archi's the first time, you'd assume that the place was as plain as the exterior of the restaurant... Not at all true. 

Boo! No refills on Thai Ice Tea!! Some restaurants refill, some don't and Archi's does not. That's the only reason why I knocked one star off.

I was never a big fan of curry, but Archi's has changed my mind.

There are several Archi's in Las Vegas, but this location is my favorite.  I love their pineapple chicken curry and they put the right amount of spice (#5). 
The service is good, very friendly, and check on the customers regularly.  

The atmosphere is simple and the restaurant is clean.  I would definitely go back and must try an new item.

I loved their food till today. Customer service/management was POOR! A meal for one person at our table was completely forgotten, until we reminded the server of it. The server did not seem to understand that we were ALL eating a meal there at the same table at the same time. The meal was then brought out when everyone else at the table was almost done. Drink refills were never offered as well. To top it all off, NO apology was offered AND they would not adjust the bill. The management actually argued with us. That is NOT how you keep customers coming back. There will be a least six less Las Vegans dining there from now on.

Great meal. Tom yum soup hits the spot on a cool day. 
Last couple trips here it seems the soup and entrees come out very close to each other. I would prefer to eat the soup before the entree arrives. 
But a solid meal everytime.

Archi's is a decent enough Thai restaurant - 3 stars - but when we visited today the manager/supervisor who seated us was surly and angry, for no apparent reason. She seated us and then came to the table 3 minutes later to take our order- "are you ready"(add attitude)...we ordered a few minutes later and she didn't say thank you, or do you have any questions... Menus taken away with a sneer... Saw her leave at 5pm, barking orders to her staff. Bad karma rolls downhill Ms. Supervisor/Manager ... Not coming back. RUDE.

I've never had a bad experience here! Food is good, reasonably priced and pretty quick. They have all the standard Thai dishes, so if you're looking for a good Thai place, you will probably find the dish you're looking for.

"It was the best of times, it was the worst of times", sums up our most recent visit to Archies. "The best " was the food. Pork Satay, Pad See ew and Pad Kea Mow are favorites and always perfect. "The bad" was the service. Usually its okay at best, but today they acted like we were interrupting them by showing up. Every phase of customer contact was terrible, from the time we walked in and waited at host stand for 10 minutes just to get a grunt of an acknowledgment. to the server who seemed almost angry with us. Would have given 5 stars if service was good. Will still go there, but no as often and will probably try other locations first.

Loved Archi's Thai Café.  It was recommended by a friend in the area, and it didn't let us down.  We had basil chicken, yellow chicken curry, pad thai, & fried rice.  My 1 & 4 year old devoured the pad thai and fried rice...this may be a direct result of the amount of thai food I consumed while pregnant with both of them. 

The basil chicken and yellow chicken curry have to be some of the best I have ever had.

With that said, I had 2 babes with me and the service was a little slow, and less than attentive. They also put us in the very back corner, which felt a little like "they have kids keep them out of the main area." It took a long time to get drinks and have our order taken.

Oh well, we had the back to our selves and my kids got to sit on the long bench and were stoked!  We will be back!

I just moved to Vegas and this is my favorite place to get thai food! Their red, green, and yellow curry with tofu, and tom kha are heavenly! The wait is a bit long so if I get take out, I make sure to call at least 25 minutes ahead of time.

I absolutely love this place , the best Thai food in Vegas on my list but if we've been waiting for an hour already to get our order and everyone around us is already eating and we got there before they have ..... AND I have to say something and follow up on my order, there is something wrong ... On top of that the server did not own up to their mistake and at least say that she has forgotten about the order , "it's busy" she said... Okay... And so I give her another chance and she said give them 5 minutes ... 6 minutes later ... No sign of food coming towards our table ... Now we just look outright stupid for even giving them a chance ... HIGHLY disappointed ... I am so upset that I'm writing this review right after I walked out .. ARCHI's please increase your staff so your servers aren't running around like chickens with their heads cut off ... Smh
Very good thai basil, independent of what you enjoy in it. I also must say the service is very good.

Clean restaurant.  Pad se Yu is out of this world. That's what I get at every thai place and this was by far the very best. Extra egg  to die for.  Getting take out tonight. Can't wait to try the fried rice.

I've been coming here for years and it's fantastic! I almost always get the Tom Kha soup with a side of rice, sometimes I get the pad Thai but it's always great no matter what. The iced tea is so great, kind of floral, and the service is always on point. 

Keep being great, guys! :)

Good food, reasonable prices and clean, almost swanky atmo. 
I had papaya salad, tofu panang and some kind of delicious coconut soup...I ordered it a 7 on the spiciness scale of 1-10, and it was perfect. 
I would definitely come here again...

Big fan of this place. They have a great lunch special that is priced very good. Last time I was there I had the sweet and sour shrimp. The spice level I chose was a 5, but wasn't that hot. Next time I'll try the 6. I definitely recommend this place to someone who loves Thai food.
Really love this restaurant! Good service, good food. Their beef salad is the best!!! :-) Highly recommend!

Attempted to have dinner here, been to Archi's before for lunch many times at both locations.  Horrible service or just awfully mismanaged!  Waited 10+ minutes to be seated, wasn't ever even greeted (even speak some basic Thai).  We watched them setup a table for 2, our party was 3.  At that point we walked..not sure any of us will return.

Best Thai we have found so far after moving to Vegas.  An Extra Plus is that they have knowledge of Celiac Disease and what has Gluten.  We had family visiting for a conference.  We showed up for dinner.  We were seated promptly.  Pad Thai was some of the best I have had.  We will return, especially on a movie night!!

To be honest I've been coming here for such a long time and the flavor is really good. Recently I noticed that they are becoming stingy on meat. I didn't order a full plate of onions with 7 pieces of beef. (Which really just happened) Sadly, I'm disappointed because when I complained they came back with the same amount of meat but with more peppers to make the plate look more full. I won't be coming back.
Really enjoyed both lunch meals I've had here.  Authentic and fresh ingredients a winner. Check their lunch specials. I especially like the red curry.  The Thai ice tea is also a nice addition.

Its ok. I have had better Thai food. The resto is nice inside although they are so busy. Maybe we got the wrong dishes but the dishes we had like the Thom Kha was nothing spectacular. It was average. I had high expectations because of what I heard from people but unfortunately it did not rise to the occassion.

"You never know how strong you are until being strong is your only choice"
- Bob Marley

Archi's Thai Cafe was the first Thai spot that really stood out to me and got me hooked. They had my favorite Pad Kee Mao for years. Now, I typically go to other places because I have found almost all of my favorite dishes done better at other Thai restaurants, but Archi's remains consistent and I'll probably always have a soft spot for some of their recipes.

My love really enjoys the Yen-Ta-Fo at Archie's. I know without a doubt that if I stop by to pick her up some soup I can always pick up and enjoy some Pad Kee Mao or Panang Curry for me. While the Pad Kee Mao is not my absolute favorite version of Pad Kee Mao anymore, Archie's is still a very good and robust one, with lots of character...easily one of the better versions in town...throw in the fact that they do so many dishes well above average and you won't hear me complain about coming here.
My favoriteThai restaurant in Summerlin area .Price reasonable, clean,service fair. I love Pad se ew, beef with broccoli, thai tea and pad thai.

Ordered to go two times so far and have been thoroughly satisfied both times. I've visited a few other Thai places in the valley and have yet to found one worthwhile. Sadly I think this is the first place I've been to that had somewhat fresh vegetables. I think Archi's is "the one"!

Im a fan for the food, not the service. We got seated fairly quickly, however, it took about 5 minutes for someone to come to our table for the first time. Eventually I ordered the Pad Thai lunch special with a #2 spice level. (Spice levels range in 1-10, with 10 being the hottest) Which came with soup of the day, which our waitress neglected to inform us of, a wonton, an egg roll and of course the main dish. When the soup arrived it was OK. I asked the waitress what it was and she said coconut milk something or rather. And thats all....while the broth was good, the ingredients werent. There were thee brown hard circles, chicken, something that looked like lettuce or cabbage, green onions (I think) and carrots. I wasnt impressed. Then our main dish came out. The Pad Thai was a little too spicy for my liking and way to peanuty. I ended up only eating the wonton and egg roll and having to order a whole other meal. That was annoying. I ordered the fried rice in place of the Pad Thai and it was amazing. Thats what I go to Archi's for in the first place. The down side is I ended up paying basically $16.00 for fried rice due to me not liking my first order, they wouldnt take it off my bill. In summary: I would go again, not during lunch, and play it safe with items ive ordered there before.
Love this place! The Pad Thai is sooooo good! Be careful though, we looooove spicy food but the level 5 spice is almost too much for us to handle!
I love this place! I've been to Thailand many times, and it taste just as good.

I was introduced to Archi's by a friend of mine shortly after moving to Las Vegas in September and I have been hooked ever since! Honestly I think I stop in or take home an order at least once a month. Their beef pad thai and pork satay skewers are two of my staple favorites.

Their lunch special is a great deal with a ton of food that usually adds up to at least two lunches if you take half home like I do.

This place is truly dangerous being a couple blocks from our house but we love the food and the service so I know we will continue to be happy customers!

Finally, FINALLY, got to tick this place off my restaurant bucket list, where it has aged for several years.  Three Archi's in Vegas, and this was a first for any of them.

A restaurant that has our favorite wine, Riesling, as their house wine gets an extra star in my book, because it's never happened before.  Kudos!

We started with Tom Kha, and it was up there with the best we've ever had, loaded with white meat chicken and lots of flavor.  How did it know it would be just what the doctor ordered for the flu I'd come down with the next day?

For once, I managed to convince Herb to let me take a break from our chicken-infused life, and we ordered the Garlic Pepper Shrimp.  I was in heaven!  It was delicious, and had a good-sized helping of the elusive (at least in my culinary world) crustaceans.  I even convinced him to eat a few, since there were too many for me.  That's because there was yet another chicken dish to dig into.

Country Curry (with chicken, natch) wasn't as successful.  It was okay, but a little too bland, though we'd ordered it medium.  The waitress took it back to the kitchen for an additional helping of hot stuff, and it was vastly improved.  We've been a little skittish ever since going to Australia and learning what REAL Thai "medium" is like, i.e., smoke pouring out of your ears, so AmeriThai medium turns out to be not spicy enough too often.  

Service was excellent, and even though we got there late and were the last people to leave the restaurant, we didn't feel rushed.  

I'm looking forward to trying some of the other dishes on Archi's menu, and maybe even one of the other locations.

I often order from the lunch menu.  My go to lunch order is ginger ginger chicken.  Food is served quickly and it's a fresh made to order food!

Fresh Thai food at good price.
Consistently great Thai food. They are always busy for a reason. Pad Thai, pineapple fried rice and pineapple curry are all fantastic. Service is attentive and fast.

This was my first time at this location- I usually go to the Rainbow location. The food tastes the same. I got the Tom Ka, Pad See Ew, and Panang. My friend likes to eat very spicy food and I can handle only some bang bang! in my food so we agreed on a level 5. The food came out in a good amount of time. The soup came out first, and it was very good. My only complaint was this - the restaurant wasn't that busy, and our waitress took our order by memory. I understand that there are alot of people out there with stellar memories and take orders like this all the time, but she was not one of them. When we first gave our order, she messed up our meat selections for each dish several times. We wanted beef pad see ew, shrimp tom ka, and chicken panang. She had to recite our order to us several times. I even suggested jokingly that she should write it down just in case she mixes it up! She just laughed and said she got it. Trustingly, my friend and I were like ok, and we weren't worried. When we finally got our food, every dish had the wrong meat selection. We were thinking about sending it back but we were too hungry to even argue. All in all, never coming to this location again

My boyfriend and I visited this restaurant based on a recommendation from our new apartment manager. It was delicious! Very authentic and affordable. I ordered the fried wonton's as an appetizer. For my main lunch, I ordered the Pad See Ew, and it reminded me of my mama's cooking! 

Our waitress was very friendly and was quick to take our orders (even though it was quite busy that afternoon). We will be going back to enjoy more of their food and service!

Best Pad Kea Mow in town if you ask me and the Basil Fried Rice is just too good.  I eat my meals here at spice level 9 or 10 and it has such flavor - but be warned some say the spicing is hot (not to me but I think something is broke with me - can't get it hot enough).  

Friday's soup with lunch specials is a fantastic coconut chicken soup (Tom Kha

Also a must try is the Papaya Salad - great with a Thai beer.

And if you love Curry then get the red curry with chicken and buckle up.

I've been wanting to try this thai restaurant for years; passed the rainbow location (the 1st one?), noticed the drive-thru window, convenient. I even checked out the website a few times. Finally, we got the chance today for lunch. We are not on this side of town much, though it's not too long of a stretch (just one street). We watched a movie, caught a matinee bright and early, the first showing. It was noon. There were quite a few diners but it is spacious, so it didn't feel crowded.

The ambiance is very elegant and pretty, with many dark rich solid wood pieces of furniture, giving you the feel of being in a resort lobby---it is one of the prettiest thai restaurants around. I thought they were for show but they were functional. The decor on the walls were simple (silk greenery variety) and ornate (wrought iron looking, rectangular-shaped). Seating is mainly chairs and tables with some bench seating. There were touches of alters but nothing large (or gawdy, for that matter). The kitchen is well concealed but you can hear the cooking activity (it isn't very distracting that you don't enjoy your meal, if you can still carry on with conversation, it's all good).

I was so excited to dive in, I didn't take any pictures, but I can still see the delicious dishes in my head. (Before we went into the theater, we checked out the menu on Yelp, so we knew what we wanted.) We ordered the fried rice, chicken and yellow curry, chicken, which came with a bowl of steamed white rice. It was so yummy. The fried rice was flavorful without being overly salty. It was big. The curry dish was excellent. We had seconds but we also had leftovers. It was a little over $22, without the tip. 

The wait didn't seem long at all. The staff was nice and our server was attentive, refilling our waters without us asking. (We got greetings both on our way in and as we were leaving.) 

I am sure we will be back as my husband loved both dishes, and I loved it too. Really satisfied our thai food cravings.
Really good thai food with quick service. Portion sizes are decent. Average pricing.

What a great restaurant.  The food was delicious and so very reasonably priced.  We had pineapple curry with pork, pad prik king (spicy green beans) with chicken, vegatable chow mein, white and brown rice.  We each had two beers and the check was a very reasonable $53 with tax.  Plus there was enough left over for lunch one day this week.  The service was right on target, the food hot and delicious.  What more could one ask for?  Really great meal.

My third favorite of the three Archi's locations around town. It's the farthest from me, so therefor the one I frequent least. 

All my same favorite dishes apply to this location. Curries, noodles, soups and eggplant are always my favorite. I still steer clear of the chicken dishes. Pork, tofu, catfish and shrimp are the way to go usually.

My Thai obsession knows know boundaries and Archi's (all locations) is always there to feed the addiction. Cheap, clean, good service and food. That's all I ask for in a great restaurant and Archi's delivers every time. 

I don't order drinks here either. I hate having to pay for refills. Only my favorite Archi's on Rainbow has a fountain.

Good for the location and especially right before or after the movies.

Came in here for lunch for the first time today. My husband orders from here pretty regularly during the work week and he said it's great so I figured I'd try it out. Ordered the chicken pad thai and the basil chicken. SO YUMMY! Service wasn't bad at all, had about 3 different members of the staff come to see how we were doing, refill our drinks pretty regularly and ask if we were enjoying our meal or if they could get us anything.
Will definitely be back!

The food is great!! Had chicken pad Thai level 5. It was the right amount of spicy. Service not so great. Was never offered water. When they came to take my order still waited to be offered water. Nothing. I called the busser over and asked for a thai iced tea (which was delicious). No one came to check on me to see if the food was good or if I was finished. I had to wave a waitress down to say i was ready for my check. But the food is great.
Food is always great. We love the Beef Salad and Panang Curry. Very friendly atmosphere.

Big restaurant, nice decor, great tasting food but really slow service. I waited over 30-minutes for what was supposed to be a quick lunch. Didn't leave until an hour later and late to work. 

Here's the thing, Las Vegas has a huge Thai community. Therefore there are many Thai restaurants where the food is just as good with far better service and efficiency. normally i don't do  this but as I was walking out and people were walking in, I recommended they go elsewhere if they we hungry because of the wait time.

The best Pad Thai noodles in the Valley, bar none.  If you haven't had a chance to try their Pad Thai noodles,  you're missing out.  If you do decide to give it a try, you may want to consider trying their shrimp fried rice too.  The best thing about this spot is that they're consistent.   Enjoy!

LOVE Archi's! Always a clean and friendly environment to enjoy a meal. Yellow curry with chicken and shrimp is always a favorite with a side of brown rice (rare in town) and has a few specials for lunch. Never a long wait and the restrooms are immaculate here. A pleasure to come to Archi's! Z

One of the best Thai restaurants on the west side.  My boyfriend and I eat here a lot.  We usually order the Chicken Pad See Ew, Chicken Pad Thai and Tom Yum Kai.  The Pad See Ew is one of the best I have had, ranking up with the ones I ate in Bangkok.  The Pad Thai and Tom Yum Kai are very good as well.

Great Thai! The green curry was loaded with chicken and had good flavor, not the BEST I've had though. Their spice scale is serious, more intense than most. Papaya salad was huge, but missing more dried shrimp- I hardly saw any.

Food is great, service is not-so-great.

We came in at 6:30 today with a 3-person group and ordered everything. After 10 minutes, we got some water. I kept asking if our food was on the way and they kept saying it's coming soon. I kid you not, I waited an hour for an appetizer to arrive. The waiter might've messed up my order because an appetizer did not show up, but that was normal, so it didn't bother me. What bothered me was a couple groups came after us and they got their entrees and all the food way before us, within 20 minutes. I asked why it took so long, and they started explaining that bigger groups get superiority. Uh-no. We came in a good 15 minutes before them and got nothing. That's a weigh over money (larger groups), rather than taking care of customers in an etiquette manner. I found this completely unfair. We should at least be given food at about the same time, not 40 minutes later. At least the food was good.
Had to get my dishes 0 spicy because I was sharing them with my child.  Lo and behold, everything was still mighty tasty! Service was good & the food came out fairly quickly.

Just happened to be roaming around in our neighborhood and wanted to try something different, new atmosphere and food well this was it! After reading the reviews on Yelp we proceeded inside. Service, atmosphere all a ten! OK so far so good. We decided to order many , many items to try and get a feel for the food and the cook. Was expensive that way but now we know what we'd order next time since the portions are very generous and food was so delicious!  Was craving lots of fresh crunchy vegetables and we got it! Fish cake was completely different from anything we've ever had before was so, so good! Really we loved everything we ordered and my husband is very picky about his Asian food growing up in Hawaii,  well he loved it and we will be back!

Great food, horrible service!!! Our server practically ignored us the entire time. She forgot to put in our order and didn't even acknowledge that it took around 30 minutes for our food to come out. Then she continued to avoid our table because she knew she screwed up. Instead of fixing the situation she just made it worse. This will only be a "take out" spot from now on.

I heard and saw so many great reviews about this place so I was really excited to finally try it. We ordered Thai iced tea, yellow curry, and pad see-you. I guess I'm spoiled with all the good Thai places in town but I felt like the portions were small and the prices were slightly overprices by at least a dollar on each entree. The teas were overpriced too and not that great. I've had better elsewhere. As for the ambience, the location is convenient, there is plenty of parking, and the interior is nice. There are nice upgrades that you wouldn't find in other Thai spots like shutters and engraved drinking glasses but I care more about the food than the decor.

Enjoyed the lunch menu, nice selection and good value for money.

The red curry with tofu was a little light on tofu, but delicious.

Really appreciated the staff putting tables together to accommodate our large group, after I called about 30 minutes ahead to give them notice we were coming.

Careful!  Closed Tuesdays!
This is my favorite thai place in Vegas. I recommend the Pad See Ew, curry or class Pad Thai. You can also sub tofu or veggies for meat so it's very vegetarian friendly.

Archi's on Sahara serves up very solid Thai food. I live very close to this location and order takeout frequently, but I have eaten in the restaurant many times as well - I recommend both!

My favorite things on the menu are the pad see ew and tom kha ghai (chicken coconut soup). I love the broth so much that I usually order extra broth and less of the soup contents. Once it didn't work out so well - I got home to find that they had written "extra broc" on the top of the soup container and the entire soup was filled with broccoli! :) Even though it wasn't what I wanted, it still scores them a point for doing anything a customer asks, even when broccoli isn't actually an ingredient in the soup!!

The curries, salads, and other appetizers are quite good too (except I've never been a huge fan of the spring rolls, which are normally my favorite thing at a thai place). Prices are very reasonable and everyone is friendly. Not the best thai in Las Vegas, but good enough to keep going back!
Best Thai Food in all of Las Vegas.  Freshest ingredients, clean, inviting space and excellent service.  This is a go to place to take out of town guests for lunch or dinner.  A+

I love Thai food and this spot hits the mark! Great food, excellent selection and awesome service. The Stuffed Chicken Wings are a must and the Silver Noodle Pad Woon Sen is better than what I've had in China Town. Good morning,
I didn't receive your phone call to update me on the status of my pending lab consultation. While I do understand how incredibly busy your office is, I would like to point out how unbelievably insignificant I have been treated as a new patient. I'm not sure who runs the office and it bears mention that I have shown up with an appointment only to feel like a drop in. If there's no specialist available to aid in my treatment please let me know. Thanks and God bless.Plus it's next to the movie theater! Thai food and a movie, my idea of a killer date!

This is actually my second time here. The first time, we waited ten minutes to be seated at the almost empty restaurant. We eventually gave up before walking two does down to Bachi Burger. I decided to give it another try. I have to say, both food and service are unimpressive at best. I will not be returning.

The pad Thai was delicious! We came here when my parents were in town (from the Midwest) and neither have ever really had Thai food before. They both loved it. My mom, who hates spicy things, ordered pad Thai with 0 heat. I forget what my dad ordered, but he asked for a 7 on heat. Now, my dad has burned most of his taste buds off over the years from eating spicy things, so most things advertised as spicy barely register for him. He said the 7 was fine, it had some heat, but it wasn't too much. I didn't see a kids menu and didn't think to ask for one, but my kids, who are fairly picky, ended up eating fried rice with no problems. I really enjoyed my experience at Archi's and can't wait to go back.

Great food....not so great service. Arrived at 11:55 and we're seated promptly. Waited forever for everything else as did the ladies next to us.  Waitresses wouldn't even make eye contact us 
we had to speak up to get their attention on multiple occasions.

Yes - I'll return again since the food was so good and affordable....

Again, fighting a cold so soup was on my mind.

Surprisingly a lovely restaurant located in a strip mall with dark wooden tables and white shutters on the windows.

We sat down right away and ordered off the lunch menu, I was the exception. I ordered the chicken Tom Kha and some Thai Iced Tea.

I have to say the broth was very good and it was hot but the chicken was overcooked and rubbery.  Thai tea was very good served with lots of ice.

Our food was served right away but they were slow to pick up dirty dishes and slow to drop off the bill.

Overall it was okay but I won't come running back...at least not for the soup. I may come and try other items.

My favorite Thai place by a landslide. I go here on an almost weekly basis. Pineapple fried rice is a MUST. Panang curry is another favorite of mine (basically a thicker curry sauce, referred to as a gravy). Hope they get delivery soon.

My wife treated me to dinner tonight here at Archie's. My first time here and it was delicious. We were seated immediately. Service was great. Food was delicious. They removed our dishes in a timely manner so there was no clutter on the table. We got our check when asked and to go boxes. Everything was great. Definitely recommend for awesome Thai food.

I always like going to Archi's.  Nice folks and good place to get consistently good quality Thai food.  This location has a nice ambience and hasn't been too horribly crowded when I've been.

Get the stuffed chicken wings.  Best in town.

Lately, we've just been getting food to go.  Last time we just walked in and ordered and got our food in 10 minutes.  Awesome!  

Spice levels are from 1-5.  3 isn't really spicy at all so if you want spicy, go for a 4 or 5.  In my experience, this restaurant doesn't do crazy Thai spicy and they have been pretty conservative with the spice, at least with us.

Very cheap authentic Thai in a nicely appointed dining room.  

I liked the spicy basil beef.  They also have a great coconut soup with shrimp.  Definitely home made and tasty.

Go as spicy as you can handle or keep it mild!  Gooood Food!

Archi's is my go-to  Thai place! 

Excellent service, awesome location, and most importantly: YUMMY FOOD!! And oh my goodness, the portions! So much food! Even this fatty couldn't handle it. But hey, I love leftovers! So Archi's is perfect for me :)

The interior is decorated with dark wood and a lot of different decoration pieces. It feels more like eating at someones [rather large] home than in a generic restaurant setting. 

The food was so good! We got Chicken Pad Thai (10), Kung Pao Shrimp (9) and Mongolian Beef (9). So good, my mouth is watering just thinking about it lol. Food quality was great. Prices were on par with any other Thai place so it wasn't expensive. 

Located next to the Regal Movie Theater in Village Square and close the the Coldstone (dessert, anyone?)

I stopped in here the other night before a movie, without having done any research or prior yelping, which is very unusual and risky for me! The menu is vast, and prices pretty decent for the area, selection, and ambiance. I had the drunken noodles with beef and a HUGE portion was delivered. Tender wide rice noodles arranged on a bed of fresh veggies, wood ear mushrooms, lettuce, and flavorful beef. Around $13 w/ tax + tip I believe, quite the bargain and provided me with leftovers! Would go back if I was in the area.

The food is very tasty here.  When the server says a dish is spicy believe her or him!!  
The bathroom (women) was disgusting, however, and looked as if it hadn't been checked for an hour or two. In all fairness, I did let somebody know so I imagined it was looked into.

Ridiculous pick up service.  I put in an order and they said it would be 25 minutes because they were backed up. Then, when we went, we had to wait ANOTHER 25 MINUTES!  During that time, they could have cooked many other meals which they did.  They helped all the people in the restaurant first even though they told me it would only take 25 minutes.  Plus, we went to pick up the order ourselves.  If you are backed up, you need to tell people not to come and give a better wait time.

When I called in to complain, the manager was not very nice.  He wasn't very apologetic and just said he would talk to the person taking orders.  He didn't offer a discount or any other good will.  We have been to that restaurant countless times and the manager was very rude.  He just hung up and wasn't willing to talk it through and just complained that it was "very busy" today.  Instead, he should have offered some sort of discount or something else for having us wait for so long.

Do not order take out from them.

Last time we did it online and then found out the restaurant was closed because all of the servers had quit that day.  

This time we ordered and had to wait an additional 25 minutes.  What is the point of ordering take out if you have to wait that long.
