Finally, BEWARE when you order certain dishes.  We have ordered some dishes like curry, and the entrees, and the portion sizes are extremely small.  They aren't even big enough to fill half the plate.  I think when they are busy, they split the dishes into 2 so they can accommodate 2 take out orders.

Food wasn't bad, only problem was the wait. They don't take reservations and it was hard getting a table. At least the food was good enough to bring it up to 4 stars. Quality is way better now than 6 years ago which was the last time I was here. Friendly staff. Kinda loud and was hard to hear my gf I felt like we were shouting at each other.

Amazing! Had the pad puck with shrimp and will definitely keep going back! My bf also had the sweet and sour chicken & shrimp. Again very good. Spring rolls as an appetizer and we were all set. I hope they do carry out because I'd love to have them even when I don't feel like sitting in.

I've been coming to Archi's for years! (The rainbow and warm springs location) and the service never disappoints- the staff is friendly & quick. Also, the atmosphere is always extremely clean and modernized with a nice "cultural" feel. And don't get me started on the food! Everything is decently priced and i've never had a dish that I didn't like- Id recommend the Thai macaroni, pad Thai, or their chicken chow mien!

My go-to place for thai food :) Although it's kinda far from my house, I still like to come here whenever I want thai food.
I have tried green, red, and panang curry, pad thai, pad kee mao, pad see ew, tom yum kong, pineapple fried rice. All of them are amazingly good.
The portion is pretty decent for the price too.
Service is decent, the waiter/waitress always have a smile on their face, which is a good thing.
Definitely worth a try :)

They got the best food out of all the Archie's I been in but their servers don't really check on customers when they get busy. I see them standing around a lot making the orders come out slow. And some servers only get nice when its time to pay the check and determining how much tips to give them. BUT other than that, service is okay, food is amazing especially their PAD THAI.

I have really been wanting some good Thai food. A co worker told me about this place. Turns out it's around the corner from me. Hubby and I ordered the stuffed wings, (Sounded interesting) and I'm so glad we did. They were delicious, served with a spicy sweet sauce, yum! We ordered larb. They made it perfectly, with just the right amount of spice. We shared the beef salad with lemon dressing. The sear on the beef was perfection and the dressing was very refreshing. Hubby had a pork dish, pad prik pow (yes, that's really the name), but it was great. The service was very fast, friendly and done with a smile. I highly recommend this place. Excellent food, even if some of the names of their dishes sound.......wrong. Lol

5 stars for this visit. Food was ready in the exact time they told me for my takeout order. All the food we got was excellent. Best Thai food restaurant that we've been to in the Summerlin area - and we've tried a bunch. Glad they got their takeout business on track and glad I came back for a 2nd try.

Good food if u like it! If u r new and don't the service on behalf of the management is HORRIBLE!!! Pete the manager not only compared our experience to others on the sales item, but wouldn't be courteous enough to remove the item. I have NEVER heard of the customer when dining having this matter. 
I enjoy the food but because of treatment will NEVER eat here again!

I finally found a thai place by my house that it pretty good! I'm a huge fan of thai food and have been desperately looking for something comparable to the restaurants back in Denver, CO.  I  recommend this place for the yummy pad thai!
Would recommend their food to anyone.  Vary tasty and good specials.  Customer service is questionable at times.

This place is consistently great.  I've been here for lunch and dinner and enjoyed it every time.

For lunch, I definitely recommend ordering off the lunch section on the back of the menu.  Food is great and the price is a good deal.

For dinner, I recommend starting out with the Tom Yum soup.  Noodles are fantastic, as are the curries, and the fried rice is delicious.  The only disappointing thing I've had was the shrimp roll appetizer.  It was whole shrimp wrapped in rice paper and deep fried, which was not at all what I was expecting.

One thing to note is Archi's has a few restaurants around town and the numeric scale they use to tell how spicy you want a dish is not consistent.  A 4/10 at one location is more like an 8/10 at another.
High quality, VERY authentic (I lived in Thailand 2+ years), great atmosphere and wait staff.  The only reason I give this a four instead of five is that the menu is a little shallow and uninspired

I love this place. The food is always good. It's consistent. I always order the Panang or masaman curry, pad Thai, tom yum soup, spring rolls, Thai beef salad, and spring rolls. No complaints. The service is good too. Not spectacular, but good.

We were quite disappointed that we ordered a meal to share - portion quite adequate and some leftover - however, sooo hot and we only ordered a '2' in hot... other than that - good service, clean, probably tasty if we could taste it over the hot...

My absolute favorite Thai in Las Vegas.  

The Pad Thai at Archi's is excellent.  It almost has a buttery quality to it.  This is one of the spots I always take friends or out of towners and they are always pleasantly surprised.  

You will be happy at any of the three Archi's locations.  The Ft. Apache and South Rainbow locations are newer and nicely decorated.  The original spot on Jones and Flamingo is tiny and old but tasty as ever.  

Lunch specials are great.  I usually teeter between my favorites, the spicy basil beef, and the pad thai.  Other delicious items on the menu: papaya salad, spicy eggplant, mango with sicky rice, thai iced coffee.

They offer brown rice - always a nice option.  

Prices are right, food is delicious.  Archi's is a 5 star Thai experience.

I remember when Archi's was the namesake for Thai food 25 years ago when it sat on Flamingo/Torrey Pines and didn't have a liquor license.  I have eaten a lot of Thai food since then and finally stopped in their new location at Village Square.  I had what may have been the best pad Thai ever.  Everything was excellent.  Had the beef salad, spicy basil beef, chicken pad thai, tom kha soup  and red curry chicken.  The only plate that I was not blown away by was the red curry chicken. The curry was excellent, but I think it was the chicken slices that could have been better. They were a little flat and dry.  But seriously this is one very small complaint.  Everything else was exceptional and again, best pad thai in a long time!!!
Food is very good and the price is reasonable but the service tends to be on the slow side. So don't go there if you are in a hurry.  Be ready to spend time.

Archi's is fine gourmet Thai cusine that have higher standard of quality restuarant over all Thai resuarants as well as all others type.Focus only on few popular dishes that would be everyone favorites is hit the local market of can't live without it.All locations are cleaned service is good.You always will be happy with the test of Thailand here.The prices and sizes are awesome.

Not bad for a good Thai restaurant. I've gone to all of Archi's Thai restaurants and I believe this one is the BEST! I came to this Thai restaurant with my cousin many years ago. After many years of not going, this restaurants seems to get BUSIER every time and GAIN popularity. 

From my last visit (3/ 25/16), I ordered their Chicken Pad Thai, Beef Salad, and many more at this restaurant and it's very GOOD and DELICIOUS!

I RECOMMEND coming here because this Thai restaurant is the best around this area. They have good staff but I recommend coming around 2-5 p.m. because they are not that busy around that time. Otherwise, you will be waiting for your food at least over an hour with the place crowded and servants busy.

I went there for dinner tonight and had a most annoying experience ever. They greeted us so I told the worker 2 adults and 3 kids. I need 2 high chairs and room for a stroller. Then a girl took us to a big table which was perfect. She brought us 2 high chairs and kids were all seated and we got everything situated then they told us we needed to move because they thought there was more people. That place wasn't even that busy. I was annoyed but just swallowed and got all the kids and went to a different table. It was a same size table that they sat us! So we were trying to get situated again and someone came and told us to move to a smaller table. I was annoyed AF and the girl saying I thought more people.. WTF do they not understand English or just plain stupid? I was so pissed we decided to leave. They didn't apologize or anything. If you're stupid then that's fine with me but don't be wasting my time and energy. Definitely not going back there.

Decent service. Food tasted great. Real restaurant quality. 

I love how much amount of food they give you. Its usually more than enough so I take them home and enjoy them later on. Tastes just like other delicious thai restaurants but with more food.

Especially for pad thai, i've had better pad thai but just cannot go anywhere else anymore because of the amount that this place give us.

I have two favorite thai restaurants and this one is one of them.
I love this place, its a little expensive but they do have a lunch special suring the weekdays....you get the choice to pick how spicy you want your plate 1-10
The service  is so good.   Their lunch specials are very good, and the portions  are large.  Excellent Thai food.
Nothing to write home about but not horrible.  Probably wouldn't want to come back since there are other options for Thai nearby.

Pad Thai was a little salty and greasy... and they charged my friend $1.99 for extra rice !!!  Been coming here several times already and not been charged extra for additional servings of rice (which is the usual for Asian Restaurants)... Rice is like water to most Asians... should be free !
Came in for lunch. Such a cute place.soft instrumental music playing. Clean big comfy chairs, but the food took a while. The service was poor, but I enjoyed their food.

I don't know why I keep going back to this place, it hasn't been a pleasant experience the last three times I've been, I need to remember to scratch this place off forever.  The service is mediocre and the food is not what it used to be.  Waiters do not bring food out in unison and the food is no longer exquisite, flavor is just not the same anymore.

Neat little place, the food was great but like other reviewers the service was lacking. It wasn't busy when we arrived but an hour and a half to wait for food is kind of ridiculous. Also, they forgot one of our dishes which took another half hour after asking about it three times. By then the place was busy. And three hours later we finally got our check.

Food gets four to five stars. Service gets three to four. To be fair, I went on a Saturday night so they were busy.  Their prices are lower than I would have expected. All in, it's a good restaurant. I will go back.

i was a little hesitant to try another thai restaurant in vegas because it felt like i was betraying LOS by doing so. but my friends (both locals) were very convincing so we decided to finally try this place. i'd have to say this is not a bad "other thai option" if one is craving thai food and don't have the time to wait (or was unable to make a reservation) at LOS. 

the tom kha was good, the glass noodles (forgot the thai name) was one of the best noodle dishes i've had, the combination fried rice was well seasoned and could very well be a full meal on its own, and even the spicy basil pork was pretty tasty. the only thing that was amiss at our table was the red curry. it was like 3/4 bamboo shoots. will never order that again. 

i ordered spicy level 2 but next time i think i'll try a 3. 

overall, this is a solid thai restaurant.

If you're looking for some solid Thai food, this is a place to be.  It definitely appeals to the American palate. Their food is a great introduction for those looking for something different and savory.

I really like Archi's. Good food, nice ambience, fairly inexpensive and close to my house. What's not to love?

Since discovering Archi's I've stopped going to my old, cheap Thai eats place, Thai Style Noodle. When I can pay an extra $2-$3 for an infinitely better dish, it's a no brainer. The noodles are great. I usually get the Pad Seeyoo(sorry about the spelling) or Pad Thai. Both great options, but it really depends on the day. The chefs are usually pretty consistent.

Thai Basil Fried Rice is good too and the curries are delicious. One of my only complaints is that even though they ask you your spiciness preferred level (1-10), their tastes usually run hot. No biggie, but when I'm with people that want mild, they expect mild and I don't want them having a bad time that night or the next day.

Anyways, Archi's is now in my restaurant rotation so I hope they continue to stay yummy.

I wanted to grab a bite to eat before seeing a late night movie next door. We arrived around 8:30 pm so I thought whatever I get should be light. Then I thought again ...I'll order a side of Pineapple Fried Rice just in case. My husband ordered the Thai Beef Salad which has grilled top sirloin, tomatoes, red onion, cucumber, green onion, cilantro, and hand-tossed in spicy lime dressing . That salad never lets me down..it always turns out really good. I ventured away from my usual chicken curry dishes and wanted to also order a salad. I chose the Papaya Salad that had sliced green papaya, tomatoes, green beans, peanuts, dried shrimp, and spicy lime dressing. When I read it on the menu my eyes failed to see the dried shrimp. I was picturing nice big juicy shrimps on top of that salad. When they served it I thought "Maybe I forgot to mention the shrimp" ..because I couldn't see them. I started eating the salad and my husband starts eating it too. Then I tasted the little dried up shrimps which are smaller than the peanuts so they are barely noticeable. I dare not say a word because my husband loathes mostly all seafood and he already ate half of of the dish! It was a nice crunchy salad because of the papaya but I didn't mind. If I were to get this again I would have them leave out the dried shrimp because I'm not a fan of it. I also had my safe Pineapple Fried Rice which has Jasmine rice, stir fried with tomatoes, onion, green onion, pineapples, cashews, raisins, egg and cumin powder. It's a nice melody of flavor that blends nicely together. I had to stop myself from taking more than a few bites so I wrapped the rest of it for lunch for the next day. We ended with the Mochi Ice Cream which comes with three flavors we chose Red Bean, Green Tea and Strawberry for my husband.( He has a hard time trying new things) I always enjoy the ambiance here because it's relaxing and the food is delicious!

I love Archi's! I've been eating here for years. But I have to say the west flamingo location shits on the west Sahara location, in service and consistency. On flamingo, I know the pad Thai is always going to taste the same and the service is on point. Sahara.. The food is always good, but always different. And the staff is never in a hurry. Tonight I saw one server in the entire dining room. As it got busy, she looked like a deer in headlights. Really? Get more help! This happens every time I go there.

Been this location 3X plus 2 others. Hidden deep in rear of lot next to movie theater on NW corner.  Pad Thai noodlesw/shrimp combo, spicy eggplant, Kung Pao w/pork, Pineapple fried rice,  All delish! I got level 4-5 spice and do not consider that to hot, but I like bold, spicy food. If you don't get zero heat or only 1.  The Thai iced tea is so good and different. Tea but rich and spicy, creamy and you get a huge glass.  I recommend you tell the waitress to go light on the ice but am hooked on it and going to beg for the recipe. This is not for people in a hurry on a 30 min lunch. Everything is custom cooked, hot, fresh and delicious. You get your choice of meat w/each dish and choose your heat level. The lunch combo includes a side of greens, spring roll and cup of soup with your entree all for about $7-$9 depending on your meat choice. Good for Vegan's too.  Best Thai I've found!

The BEST Thai food in town!
Archie's deserves 5 stars for the great food, ample portions, friendly & efficient employees, and a clean restaurant.  I have never been disappointed and I eat there regularly 
It doesn't hurt that the restaurant is next door to a Regal theater which makes the combo a perfect date night destination.

Amazing place, full of authentic decor and ambiance! Papaya salad is so refreshing and full of flavor. Combination pad thai with pork beef and shrimp is enough for two meals.  Thai toasts for an appetizer consists if minced chicken and shrimp baked on toast served with cucumber salad. It us a must try!!

I have to comment on the service here above all. Our waitress brought paper for my granddaughter to draw on. When she got fussy she gave me the check quickly.

I had the Pad Soon Wen. The bean sprouts were crisp and the egg bits tasted freshly cooked. For $2 more I had five shrimp. The shrimp were pretty big. To be honest I would rather have seven medium shrimp especially for two dollars. 

The food was good and the service was great. I will definitely visit again.

My first review on Yelp. And I had to leave a review here.
Oh my holy God. The WORST of the WORST!
It was my first time at a thai-sh restaurant and I truly do wish I could write a happy, positive, 5star highly recommended kind of review but I can not and you will know why in 2 seconds.
I found two pieces of tapes(LONG) inside the chicken noodle soup after having a couple bite. I first thought it was a piece of uncooked noodle because the texture was similar, but it was a piece of shittttt!!! Imagine what would have happened if I swallowed it by accident? Thinking of, 'oh this one piece is not cooked throughly, but its oki doki my stomach is strong enough to digest anythang' 
Anyways, I called the server A.J and he apologized sincerely along with a free dinner (we prolly ate about 15% of the dish)which really did stop me from calling the health department for a further investigation. Seriously I feel sick right now.

Whoa. Their Thai iced coffee is gargantuan! I forgot to look and see how much it cost but I could only finish about 1/4 of it and so the rest went to waste. :( I also ordered a red curry with tofu and it was very good even though I only ate maybe 1/10 of it. I liked the fact that the tofu was lightly fried which means less fat! My friend Adam kept me well distracted and I totally forgot to eat my food. Oops. 

This place is casual, nice, clean and spacious. It's right next to the movie theater so you can grab lunch or dinner before the movie. I kind of wish we had more time so I could try the mango and sticky rice dessert. This warrants a return trip in the near future!

Archi's is by far my  favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas. I've been coming here with friends for the past couple years now and the food here is to die for. You can get your food however spicy you want it ranging in a scale of 1-10 of how spicy you want it. I've always left this place with a smile. They have great service and three convenient location here in Las Vegas. Definitely a place to go for some good Thai eats.
My wife loves the Tom Yum soup, and the Thai iced tea is great.  I pretty much like everything on the menu. We always visit this place when we're in Summerlin.

I went there today and it was absolutely horrible....service was something I normally would have walked out but I was meeting someone there....It took at least 10 min of waiting there before anyone greeted me and I was the 2nd table in the whole restaurant. I finally had someone greet me and I asked if I can have there WiFi password and they dont offer that...which ruined my whole meeting. 

There were at least 4 servers on the floor and none of them cared that we were sitting there.....Service is not worth it but food is good.

One of my favorite Thai places in town.  Whenever I am on the west side of town craving Thai food, this is where I go.  I feel like it used to be cheaper then it is now, which was part of the reason I loved it so much.

We had a bad experience at the restaurant. We ordered fried rice and their country curry; the fried rice came out 10 minutes before the curry and it got cold, the servers did not check up on us to inform us about our curry dish or even help to improve our experience, and the country curry was not prepared up to its usual standard. As we were leaving the restaurant, the owner was standing at the register and counting cash, and he did not acknowledge our complaints. There are better Thai restaurants all around town that maintain a standard of service and this restaurant did not have it.

The food was amazing, but the thing that lost them my 5 stars was the service. There's this one male server with the tattoo sleeve that continued to avoid giving us service. His coworkers were great, but his lack of service was what killed it.

Location wise is perfectly situated right by Regal Cinemas in Village Square! Conveniently accessible for those hunger cures before of after a movie.  For those unfamiliar...Archi's Thai Cafe may seem like another Asian/American Fusion like PF Changs...or pick up stiX...but in fact when one takes a closer look, 100% Authentic Thai is clearly shown.  Try and behold for this is true.  Upon first walking in, the restaurant feels small, but the wooden shutters, and wooden tables and chairs balances this out and gives you a good feel of solidity to its decor.  This is not your usual Asian themed furniture but don't let this fool you, for the food is as good as it gets.  

Waiters will take your order and ask you from a level of 1-10 how spicy you would like your food to be, and plenty enough to satisfy all types of taste buds and spice level to handle.  Tom Kha may not be for everyone but It is a great little soup starter like won ton soup for Chinese food.  Price could be cheaper, but the quantity of food is decent enough and good enough for the price.  I don't know if your typical person would go everyday, but nice to have once in a while.  Thai food is comparable to Pin Kaow or Lotus of Siam

Archi's is clean and food comes out at a respectable time frame. A little advice tho, get there before 6pm or off times because after 6pm the restaurant starts to get busy and picks up a lot of customers...you may have a line out the door or wait.  Others must think it is good though to keep coming back for more.  Give it a try...It is pretty good.
You know the food is good when you're full but want to keep on eating. Had the red curry lunch special. Delicious. Really great price for what you get.
Love getting their Pad Thai and Spicy Basil. On top of that I get a Thai Tea. Best one Thai food I had in Vegas so far!

I tried Thai food here for the first time with my girlfriend and her family and let me say, this place is amazing. The service is great and so is the food. I get Chicken Pad Thai with a level 4 spicy and it's just the perfect balance of noodles and chicken with just that kick of heat to turn up the tastiness!!!!

Eh, i honestly don't see what the hype is about. Pad thai was mediocre to say the least-had no tofu, the noodles tasted of shrimp (never tasted that before) and it was spicy after i specifically said "no spice". Service was below an "eh" but above "awful". I asked for extra napkins and instead of responding he walks away so my friend asked if he heard me. I waited to see what he would do before i said anything and he ended up walking to a station to get napkins...is it that difficult to say "sure" or "yes"? Not the worst thai place but i will definitely be visiting OSHA in San Fran next month!

I've been to this location a few times before and its always been good food and good service however I met up with my friend just 45 minutes ago and I couldn't wait to get out of there! 
We walked in and a girl with a bob haircut was at the computer, she looked at us and looked back down at the computer then looked back up to us with the most miserable facial expression. Um 2 please. She grabs two menus, puts it on the first table and walks away. Uh okay weird but whatever. Then after five minutes another girl asks if we want sometimes to drink and then another girl comes and asks what we want to order. The food comes out quick but here comes the girl with the bob again, she puts down the food at the edge of the table, doesn't even look at us and walks away. So now we're watching these girls and they're nice to every other table except us! My friend is Ethiopian and there is no one else in this restaurant with darker skin color and I don't want to say they were being racist but I don't know why else we were treated so horrible. These girls didn''t come back or say anything to us except fill waters but they kept watching us from a far and kept looking at us. I don't know, maybe they were hungry? But regardless, never coming back to this location again.

Good place for lunch during the workday if you can risk taking a little over an hour at times.  They are usually pretty good at turning tables, but it seems towards the end of lunch they get a little tired and take longer.

The food is really good, I like the Pad Thai, eggrolls, and wonton soup.
we eat here once a week with our three kids best larb chicken salid on the planet

I LOVE Thia Beef Salad, so my wife wanted to go somewhere nearby. This is the closest place to my home. (So this isn't my first time here) None the less this 2 star rating was well earned, as I write this I am thinking one star. To start off, this is one of the few locations in town that charge you for refills.  2nd, FAT should not be part of a salad. I had to tear apart the meat from the FAT using a spoon and fork.  3rd, we shouldn't have to ask three times for Water or Napkins. I mainly disappointed in the fact that my Hamburger I had earlier today had more lettuce than this Thia Beef Salad. Is there a shortage on lettuce I don't know about??? This being the 4 valid concern, I am changing from 2 stars to a more deserved 1 star. I hope this was a fluke and they return to there ways, of better customer service.

First time coming here with my cousin and husband and kids. Very small place but the service was good and the menu had a good selection.  Love how they rate the level of spicy for you, although we got a 5-6 it was pretty spicy! We loved it!  We couldn't finish everything and we has left overs! Awesome! Very authentic Thai Food!!
Fresh spring rolls and Satay chicken are good appetizers. Pineapple curry combo was delicious. Sweet and sour chicken is the same as anywhere else.

Archi's is my current favorite Thai restaurant in town, and I have tried many including Thai Spice, Komol, Lotus of Siam, Thai BBQ, Pin Kaow, Marnee Thai, Promarres, King & I, Panna Thai, Tipps, and Basil 'n Lime. This is their 3rd and newest location.

We usually get the Pad See-Ew, Pad Thai, Spicy Eggplant, and sometimes a Thai Iced Tea. My wife also loves their Green Papaya Salad and enjoys their various curry dishes. For the spicy dishes, they will ask you how spicy you want it on a scale of 0 to 10. We usually go with "2" because their "3" can be extremely hot, as in sweat-inducing, nose running-like-a-river hot! I can't even fathom what a "10" might be like. Their prices are very reasonable except I do get annoyed when they charge you $1 for a small bowl of rice without letting you know ahead of time. Pet peeve, I know.

What distinguishes this place from most other Thai restaurants (and the original location) is the warm, clean, and contemporary interior. You feel like you are dining in an upscale restaurant instead of a hole-in-the-wall joint. Service is typically friendly and efficient.

The combination of quality food at reasonable prices, solid service, upscale ambience, and as an added bonus its proximity to home make this our go to place for Thai. Well done, Archi, well done.

I'm impressed!  This was some pretty good Thai food.  And my favorite part is that they have a spicy level that goes from 1-10.  I like my food on fire so of course, I ordered my food at a 10.  She told me it will be "very spicy."  After I did that, I was nervous for a minute. Then, I got my food.  I got a Tom Yum Seafood soup at spice level 10.  Okay, it was hot and you could just smell the spice.  But for me, I think it was just right. In fact, I think I could've handled it spicier.  And from reading the reviews below, it appears that the spice level may even go higher - to a 30?!?!?!  Perhaps I'll have to try a higher level next time.  But in any event... the food was good.  The only thing that I didn't like was the summer rolls, but that's only because I think in my head I was thinking of the Vietnamese summer rolls.  These particular rolls were actually wrapped in a flour tortilla and on the inside, it had Chinese sausage, veggies, and other stuff.  It was different. It was good.  But it was just not what I expected.

I was feeling ill last week, so I decided to get some soup and noodles to sustain my cold, and I tried this place out since I live down the street, and I was impressed! the chicken soup and a variety of vegetables and had a good bite of spice to it which helped clear up my chest congestion and the chicken noodles especially tasty with carrots and lettuce chopped in it. I'll be trying this place soon again with it being right next to the movie theater makes it even better.

We were in the mood for Thai and came across this place so decided to get food to go. When I first walked I noticed they were very busy with people waiting to be seated and others picking up food they had ordered to go.  I realized there will be a wait time for my food so I ordered our food and was told it would take 40 minutes which I didn't mind. I left and came back 40 minutes later only to be told it was not ready yet. It was 1 hour since the time I ordered that we finally got our beef salad and wor won ton soup. I must say the food is good however the only reason I gave it stars 4 is because of the long wait time for to go orders. 

Tip: either eat there or call in your order for pick up.
First time. Very slow service. Not bad food, but not worth the trouble waiting to get served. First and last time we will eat their.

I've eaten here twice with friends & I always let them order because I'm no Thai food expert, but I know when stuff is tasty, and Archi's serves up some tasty food! I used to frequent the movie theater next door when I was a teenage hoodlum and remember when this place used to be some really crappy Americanized Chinese food place that always smelled like crappy Chinese food. I was really surprised it was the same place considering how cute & Thai-like the inside looked! 

We've sampled their yellow curry, panang curry, beef and basil, pineapple fried rice, pad thai, pad kea mao, and papaya salad. My favorite is the panang curry! Omgosh, it was so delish, until I went home and checked out the calorie content. Panang curry typically has about 40-50g's of fat for one serving. Ouch! Well, anything with that much fat better be worth it, and I'd say that one serving of panang curry is worth it. Their pad thai is on the greasy side and kind of bland when you think about what's in it. I definitely prefer the pad kea mao because it has more veggies and tastes like basil (yum!!!)  compared to what you'd get in pad thai with just bean sprouts & peanuts.

I did not enjoy the papaya salad. It was my first time trying it, but for $10, you get a "salad" that has a grated green papaya and this "dressing" that just tasted like fish sauce? Did they give us the wrong sauce? I don't know. Regardless, I will be back to Archi's! It has a cute ambiance with some delicious options. Definitely try the panang curry & pad kea mao!

Gahhh I love this place so much! This is my go to Thai restaurant that has a well rounded menu. The place is large and spacious. It's cozily decorated in a way that kinda makes me feel at home. Haha. 

My go to is their tofu panang curry, pad thai, and tom kha - extra spicy! My family especially loves their spicy basil beef. It's making my mouth water just thinking about it. Ugh. 

However, the service is pretty inconsistent. It varies every time I come in. Sometimes it would take them a while to take our orders or for our food to come out; while other times they were efficient and speedy! I would recommend coming in at lunch time, when it isn't too busy.

I lunched here today with a coworker. The decor and atmosphere are delightful. The food was delicious! I ordered the chicken with basil lunch special (lvl 4 spicy). My friend had the green curry chicken (lvl 7 spicy). I will order it more spicy next time, but the dish was very flavorful, fresh and delicious. The egg roll and the fried wontons were standard, nothing special. The soup of the day was nice and refreshing, although one bite of the big chunk of ginger was a bit overpowering. We weren't told the name of the soup, but it was in a broth with chicken, lemongrass and veggies. The lunch specials were a deal at 6.95 each, and the portions are not skimpy! I will return here soon!

Pretty good Thai food. 

I had the only curry that doesn't use a coconut milk base, I believe they called it "country style".  It was in a chicken broth.

The country style curry had a nice savory broth and plenty of heat (I ordered it hot). The shrimp were plump and juicy.  I would have preferred more and different veggies.

The atmosphere was pretty nice and the service was good if a little rushed seeming.

Bottom line?  I'd go back but they're not high on my list of Thai places in Vegas.
Panang curry double chicken w/ brown rice level 8 is BOMB.COM . I get take out here weekly! Very clean and healthy!

Good chicken Tom Kha--great broth and the chicken had little to no fat, but it had that stale chicken flavor that I hate...the tinge smell--that almost ruined it but great broth!  The pad seayou chicken was great--- so so good!  It was better than the beef by far!  Generous portion of Thai iced teas, and clean and good service.  I will be back--hopefully often but I am always scared of chicken that's of fresh.

The owner needs to take a customer service class. I admit I had mistakenly ordered at wrong location. I had called in an order @rainbow instead of Sahara. But I come all the time at Sahara location since day 1 that they opened and they won't let me eat today or make another order.. I understand its my fault but he said" I have to give you hard time",thats not how do business

I have eaten in once and I had take out again tonight - about the 6th time I've had Thai food from here.  It is wonderful!  I really like the place, but since it's so close to my house and my wife doesn't do Thai, I get her Chinese on West Charleston and then bop over here to get my dinner for home.

I have been through all of their curries.  I usually get an 8 spiciness and I could go higher.  Next time, I'll do 9 for a try.

I really enjoyed the one time I ate in.  The restaurant is very nice.

I was looking for a Sprint store and remembered there being one near Ft Apache and Sahara, but I arrived too late and they were already closed.  So I decided to check out Rising Sun Sushi, which is supposedly located in the same strip mall (sign is still up), but after driving around the entire strip mall and not seeing any sign of Rising Sun and finding Archi's Thai Cafe next to the movie theater I decided to check out their dinner menu.

The restaurant itself looks nice, the dining area is split into 2 sections (at least), as I was directed to a corner table in the smaller more secluded dining section closest to the parking lot.  I was hoping to be seated in the main area, but whatever.  They have a few waitresses and 1 waiter, and I am not sure if they take turns in getting customers/tables, but I ended up with the waiter that still have a lot to learn about getting better at being a waitperson in a restaurant. If the number of guestcheck holders in their apron is a direct count of the number of tables they are currently assigned, then I would say he has 3 tables to look after while I was there, and he was overwhelmed with just those 3 tables.  After I ordered and the food was served (by a different waitress), he did not come by to check up on the table until I was practically done eating, and it took forever (at least 5 minutes, but most likely not more than 10 minutes) to have him come by again to pick up the money.  This while at least 10 people were eying me sitting there waiting, while they wait for a table to be freed up so they can get seated and order some food.

Anyway, moving on to the food.  I have tried the curries before, and I thought about trying something new.  Sukiyaki (Thai Style) was what i ended up ordering, and I was thinking a Japanese Sukiyaki with Thai ingredients.  Completely wrong imagery!  What I ended up with was a bowl of Thai noodle soup that I remember eating at one of the street food vendors when I was a kid in Bangkok.  The flavor was the same as what I vaguely remembered. It was served piping hot (good), with lots of vegetables (sure why not), a lot of pieces of chicken and 2 shrimps, plus a side of chili paste (cool, you can adjust how spicy you want).  But still I thought that item was overpriced for what it really is, and I will not order it again.

The Thai Iced Coffee is still large, and I think is worth the price of admission, and still very enjoyable.  I sometimes feel like just ordering that to go, if I am too lazy to shop at one of the Asian supermarket that sells them premade in cans or as a mix.

Overall:
Service: 2/5
Food: 3.3/5
Price: 2/5 (For their Sukiyaki - Thai Style)
Atmosphere: 4/5

This location is not recommended if you want to try Archi's and staying on the Strip, as their W. Flamingo location would be closer, and my experiences there have always been a good one. But if you live near this location, by all means drop by and try any of their curries.

I am a big fan of Thai food, so when I moved here, I saw a whole bunch of Thai Restaurants that didn't impress me much. I happened to accidentally stumble upon Archi's Flamingo location by turning into that parking lot since i couldn't make a U-turn. I decided to give it a go a week later with my auntie and I was impressed. 

The atmosphere inside the restaurant is warm and inviting, something about it makes you feel like you belong there. I dunno, it's weird. I got there a little after lunch time started and it wasn't that busy. I was greeted by two waitresses and they were very friendly. 

The menu has a pretty good selection, and most dishes you have the choice of what type of meat (or shrimp) that you want. I pretty much just looked for what I know, and ordered it up. My auntie ordered the Pad Thai with Chicken, i ordered the Curry and we shared a plate of Papaya Salad. YUMMY. It was so good, the curry had a nice balance of spiciness and creaminess with a touch of sweetness. The papaya salad was good too, when we ordered it they ask how spicy you want it. Well, other places you go to, when you say spicy it's usually just mild. HA HA. No, not in this case, it was so spicy we had to take it to go and work on it another time! :) But my favorite dish, till this day is the Pad Thai. It has such a RICH flavor to it, and when you receive it, YOU mix the noodles, sprouts and peanuts yourself. :) 

So far, I'm liking it, I will be back hopefully next time to try out more dishes!

When we arrived there was no waiting area and we were standing around tables waiting to be seated. There were tables open and people weren't being seated in a timely manner.

After we sat down a server came and told us and "you want drinks?" And we all just wanted water and the guy gave us a dirty look. After we got our waters we waited 15 minutes for someone to come take our order. We had to go ask someone to take our order. After taking our order they took forever but as I was looking around people who sat down after us got their food and was practically half way done with their meal. I got up to speak with the manager and he walked away from me. He had our food on the tray he was bringing out and walked over to our table and started to place them on the table as I was trying to tell him about how terrible the service is. After he put 2 of the 3 plates we ordered down he told me that they are busy and that's why it took so long. Being busy doesn't excuse you to give some of your customers crappy service. And when someone is speaking to you, you shouldn't turn your back and walk away.

Food was okay. Had a lot of toppings in the curry but no soup.

I'm giving Archie's a 3-star review based on their phone service should be one star but I've had their food in the past and it was excellent. Tried to call earlier this evening to order some pineapple fried rice , lady asked me if I could hold for a few seconds and then set the phone down, 5 minutes later she is still not come back on the line. Frustrated I hung up and attempted to call back now it's been 25 minutes and the line is still busy. I'm presuming it's still sitting on the counter waiting for someone to pick it up and take my order from my original call. I guess you have to order in person.
Great food, Ok (not so great) service.  Strongly recommend. This is probably the best  Thai food place in Vegas.
Great dining experience, wonderful service and excellent Thai food!  Highly recommended if you are looking for great Thai food that allows for spice accommodations from 1-10.

Not going back to this location after today!

 About 2 weeks ago my 3 year old daughter and I went to eat there just before 5 pm on a Friday. We got our food and after only a few bites, my daughter needed to use the restroom. I could not locate a staff member to let them know that we would be right back so we left our practically untouched food there and quickly went to the restroom. Just before that, the restaurant started to get extremely busy and large numbers of people began showing up. We returned to our table about 5 minutes later, only to find that our plates had been cleared and they had already seated somebody else there. When i let the hostess know that we were at the restroom and not done eating, she said that they threw our food away because they thought we left without paying. I asked if we could be seated in a different table and have our order re-made quickly and she said that they did not have any tables for 2 people and that there was going to be a wait. I asked if they would be able to make our order to go and again, she said that there was going to be a long wait since they were busy. I also spoke to a manager about this who apologized, but again did not offer a solution. Even though we did not get charged for the few bites that we ate, i find it very frustrating that my dining experience was ruined (not to mention that I am trying to feed a 3 year old dinner) all because they got busy and in a hurry to seat everybody that showed up just after 5. I vowed then that i would never go back to this location. 

Then...today I was in the neighborhood and thought i would give them a second chance. I ordered a Thai beef salad (spicy #2). I have ordered this more than 5 times at this location and it was always perfect amount of spice for me. I also order it this way at the Flamingo location (which has always been amazing!) I was sooooo disappointed to taste my salad, only to discover that they did not put ANY spice at all. (totally changes the taste of the salad!) I called them from work (30 min away) and let them know. Instead of apologizing, they started yelling at the cook (with me still on the phone) and came back on the line and said that they did put spice and that #2 is not hot and i should have ordered it hotter. I told the girl that i always order it this way and i know they did not put any spice, she just said sorry i asked the chef and they did put spice (basically calling me a liar). She said that i could bring it back in and get a new one. I let her know that i work 30+ min away and i am not coming back on a Friday after 5 (considering my last Fri experience). She put me on hold and I think talked to a manager. She came back on the line and said that next time I should have brought it back right away. 

Clearly, not returning here! Also, I am pretty upset about the whole thing, considering I have never left a review good or bad on yelp.

Archi's is an incredible place for good Thai food.  They have a wide selection of tofu dishes that I am able to choose from. The food came out in a timely manner considering it was pretty packed for lunch.  I have only been to the Sahara and Fort Apache location, but the service there was great.  The lunch specials rock!  Red curry with tofu and brown rice!  Perfection!

We love Thai Food and Archi's is where we go for our fix. It's definitely spicy though so those of you who think you can handle the 5 may want to rethink it if you want to taste your food. I'm typically a 5 but usually go with a 3 here. Just the right amount of hot.

Great food but WTF is up with them advertising they close @ 10pm when they turn u away when you walk in @ 9:30pm. They told us kitchen was already closed but if we wanted to order for take out we could!!! WTFFFF!!! Kitchen's close but if we order to go they'll open it??? Unprofessional, your in America practice american restaurant practices & serve till your advertised closing hours. I can see if we had walked in @ 5 or 10 mins of but WTF 30 mins before?  You lost me as a customer, there's plenty of better & less expensive Tai restaurants all over Vegas & with better service!

I always end up coming to archis at this location, just because it's the closest one to my house. I've tried archis that are at different locations. For all of the locations I've tried ( sahara, flamingo, and warm springs), heres my review:

Food : always on point with their spicy level, tastes and look fresh, never found a hair in my food, and everything I've tried tasted so delicious (esp. Pad thai with beef)

Waiting time: if you go there at a peak time for lunch or dinner, wairing time to be seated or get your food will take longer than usual but that's expected for any restaurant. Usually I find my waiting time to be OK

Customer service: this part let me drop down 2 stars. No matter what time, day, or which location I go to, customer service is just not good. One time I was still working on my plate maybe half finished,  but my server just took the condiments without asking me if I'm done with it or if I still need it. I find that so rude... and nobody really smiles

Hands down BEST Thai food I have ever had, better yet...best of Las Vegas!!! Amazing service, beautiful restaurant, great for family dinner or date night. The food was absolutely delicious!! Not one complaint for this lovely place!! Highly recommended to anyone and everyone!

Archi's is THE BEST Thai Food in Las Vegas. Honestly it might be the best I've had anywhere. The Sahara location is jsut as nice as all the others, and a little less crowded.
Do yourself a favor and go here as often as possible!

Tried Archies cafe for the first time. The service was great and the food was the best Tai food I've had so far. I ordered the Pad Tai 6 on the spicey scale and it could have been a little hotter. It is a great atmosphere and overall a great restaurant.
Pad Thai with tofu was real good and flavorful.  Prices were very good.   It's one of the few restaurants in Vegas that doesn't feel designed for tourists or as an afterthought.

Been to just about every Thai place in Vegas. Archis is definitely one of the best. Best beef noodle soup in town by far. Spent a month in Thailand and although the name kind of has an american feel, the food is authentic! So good! Do your self a favor and eat here. For the price, one of Vegas' gems.

The name Archi's doesn't scream Thai cuisine or anything Asian for that matter, but once you get passed the unusual name, this place is definitely one of the better Thai restaurants in Las Vegas (chain or otherwise). 

Tom yum soup is delicious here and you can really judge a Thai restaurant from the quality of this traditional Thai soup. The Lunch specials they have from 11 a.m. - 3 p.m. are a very good deal and equally as scrumptious!

Overall the interior of the restaurant is very pleasant and appealing for what it is and the menu prices are very reasonable. If you like Thai food you should stop by here sometime!

Great food.  Good ambiance!  We got there early so seating was quick.  The place filled up fast.  It ski wonder because the food is that good.  Beware ... When they say "10".  They mean it!   I liked the stuffed chicken appetizer and the spicy basil!  My friend had the catfish.  Now that was good!  She picked 10 so ...,I just tasted it.  Overall a great place for a meal !

Archie. Man. It's been awhile. I thought about you each night. Anyway... I'm here. The food you prepare for me is just so awesome. The price you charge me is even better. I can't get such a deal anywhere else. You treat me like a king, level 6 spicy of course. Thank you Archie. You deserve better. Farewell.

We've had dinner here a few times.  Love their Pad Thai and chicken!  We had an unfortunate incident on our last visit as they delivered my sister-in-law and my food order and we were completely finished before they delivered my husband and brother-in-laws food.  Once received it was cold, so it had sat somewhere.  That the staff did not notice that only two of us were eating and that we had asked a couple times and were told it was coming was very disappointing and unimpressive.  Hopefully it was a one time oversight.  Again we had ate there a couple times prior with friendly competent service.  Hot and spiciness desired is on a number system from 1-10 which is great as we have always went with friends and we all have different variations on how we enjoy our food.  The menu is extensive. Enjoy!

Just tried to call in an order for pick up. They put the phone down and never came back to take my order. I could hear staff talking in the background the whole time. I actually hung up and tried to call back as I was really craving Thai food and the line was tied up. Out of curiosity tried back several minutes later - line still tied up. They either completely forgot or just didn't care. This was mid-afternoon on a Monday... Not exactly a lunch or dinner rush.

Archi's has become my regular Thai place.  The food is consistently good, the service is nice, and the lunch specials are awesome.   I love that I can ask them to make my food without all the sugar, and they actually do it (unlike some restaurants that say they will, and make the same thing they always do).   The atmosphere in here is great, so eating in is always nice.  Take-out is always packed very carefully.  I've never had an order mix-up, or a leaky container. 
The only issue I have with Archi's is that they don't seem to give you as much rice as other places.  If you order some curry, you get a box of rice.  If you order two curries, or a curry, and a tom kha gai, you still only get one box of rice.  I sometimes end up having to make more at home, which kind of negates the whole take-out thing.  I'll just have to remember to ask for more before I leave next time.

By far the best Thai food in Las Vegas! The Pad Thai is delicious the spice doesn't take away from the flavor of the dish like a lot of other places seem to do. All of their curries are flavorful and well prepared. Overall this place has great quality Thai cuisine.

By far the best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas. Also I'd like to add that this is my new overall favorite restaurant! The service was great and the food was amazing!

I'd recommend this to ANYONE & EVERYONE in the Las Vegas area even if you're just visiting.

Love this food here! I like the pad Thai with chicken and also the red curry for lunch.. Thai tea is a must get and the beef pad see eu is bomb here as well!! Lunch specials are the way to go in this place!

Shrimp was a bit over cooked, and wasn't a a fan of buying a $2 canned soda without any refills. Other than that the rest of my meal was ok. Only reason I would come back again is for the movie theatre next door.

I love Archi's however we walked in at 9:30pm (they close at 10pm) and they told us we couldn't dine in, they were only doing to-go orders?! Very disappointed with their customer service, as we are regular customers.
I love the food but the service is very disorganized, I feel I'm always calling them. They seem to have language barrier and it's frustrating to get service here.

3-1/2 starts actually, but I'll give them the other 1/2 star for good service.

So far, the best Thai food that I've tasted in Las Vegas. That probably doesn't say much, as I've only been to one other Thai restaurant. Came here around 6:30p on a Friday night. There was a little bit of a wait, (20 minutes), but no big deal. Started off with the Satay Chicken - nice and tender, and able to cut with a fork. I didn't really care too much for the Thai Egg Rolls, not that it was bad or anything, but it was just an ordinary egg roll. It did taste a little better with the peanut sauce from the Satay Chicken. Got the Larb (spicy sausage salad). My dining partner insisted on a spiciness level of 8, then after tasting it, proceeded to complain how it was too spicy - Lol! I liked it, but it was a little sparse on the salad part. Pad Kea Mow w/ chicken seemed to be a popular dish, so, we got that one too - it didn't disappoint. Even though those were the only dishes we ordered, there was enough leftover for lunch the next day. Service was good - server kept our water glasses full and frequently checked to see if everything was ok. On my next trip here, will try one of the curries, the spicy eggplant, and possibly the stuffed chicken wings.

I had a very similar experience to Jill C.'s.  I also had the Basil Chicken lunch special and I thought it was great, also great was the $6.95 price.  I ordered the level 5 spiciness and it really wasn't hot at all.  I will definitely keep this place in my lunch spot rotation.

One of my favorite Thai Restaurants in Vegas, great food at reasonable prices. We usually get their chicken Pad Thai and chicken fried rice both are good. My only complaint is whenever we try to call for a reservation they never ever answer the phone it always goes to voicemail. 

So we usually just drive there wait for a table and the food is always great. We've tried to call for reservations on three separate visits and never get through. But the great food makes up for this inconvenience.

Just a quick and non critical warning.  The shopping center is under renovation and the parking situation is pretty hit and miss.  You will likely park on gravel and have to walk a bit till they get the lot fixed.  That having been said, this is a solid choice for delicious, well done authentic Thai food.  I've been here three times and all meals were first rate.  I have had the Pad Thai with tofu and once with chicken--8/10 hot level--both excellent.  My son swears by the sweet & sour chicken.  Pad Se Ew was excellent.

Service has been first rate here, and the lunch specials are well priced.  Will be back.
2 days straight I've on school lunch ordered the Red curry thai entrée with a SEVEN heat level and it's been consistent both times which is rare with thai food!  So good I want it again tomorrow.

Fresh but very bland Thai food.

Pleasant but I would never come back.

Way too many choices out there.

Broccoli main entre had no taste.

Spring rolls very bland.

Ginger ginger tasted like soy and ginger.

Vegetables were fresh.

Dishes $10-$13 mid range for neighborhood fair.

The food and the service is excellent!  We drove to this location because the location near us was closed! Great ambiance and clean! They even have a drive thru. There are 3 locations, you must try! Enjoy!

We came here only because next door at Bachi burger they left us waiting to be seated for 5 minutes without greeting us, so we left and thank goodness we did. I went with my mother and two children and we ordered way too much food. Pad Thai, fried rice (for my picky child), fried wonton, shrimp green curry, chicken satay and my other son also wanted tofu soup. Why so much? I have no clue but I'm glad we did because everything was delicious and now we have more for later. The only complaint I have is that the pad Thai wasn't as hot (temperature) as we'd prefer but it wasn't cold. We will definitely be going back, I just wish I knew of this place sooner.
Food ok..took about an hour for my order to be ready..way to damn busy..dont go here on a weekend

My friend Susan is always draggin me around to try new things.. 
I was a little hesitant to try it... but she was driving . 
We sat down and ordered. 
I ordered Pad Thai and She ordered Pineapple fried rice.
Then we did what our Momma's taught us and Shared our dinners with each other. 
Truly good food. 
I was very impressed with the textures and flavors of the pineapple fried rice. 
the Pad Thai was not overly hot, and was pleasant on the palate
Definitely gets added to the MUST TRY AGAIN list.

Unbelievable. They lost my credit card. 

I stopped in for a solo lunch, sat down, and had their Pad Thai which I'd probably rate a 4 out of 10 - it's super greasy and not all that good. 

After I give the waitress my card to pay the bill she brings me a book with a receipt to sign but not my card.

I ask her where my card is and she's saying she would have brought it to me.

I'm wearing sweats without much stuff in my pocket -keys, wallet, chapstick, phone.. I hadn't moved the entire time - not to go to the restroom or anything. My wallet barely fits any cards so there's only one secured place it fits.

There is nothing under the table or in the seat. 

I emptied the contents of my wallet into the table in front of her.

Flipped the book inside out.

They spend all but a few seconds to look for it around the restaurant and suggest to me to cancel my card. 

No person acknowledged responsibility or even offered a genuine apology. Just the suggestion to cancel my card. 

Great advice.
This place used to be really great prior to their expansion.  They are just ok.  The foods never persistent.  Different cooks, several locations = Avg quality.

Delicious food at reasonable prices has my family coming back over and over again. I usually order the massaman and thai iced tea. They do charge $1.50 for extra rice, which perplexes me because they expexct three adults to share one scoop of rice, but whatevs. The service is fast, even when it is busy.

Food is always great! It can be really spicy so be careful when you say "10".  Only reason its 4 stars is because service is not great.  Understand they are extremely busy during lunch time but it should not be an excuse for bad service.  I now order "pick up" only.  Highly recommended.

So good the food you crave it after you et it I will be back. The service was great this was a spur of the moment place to dine before a movie.I have had a lot of  Thai food around town and this is really good food
I've definitely had way better thai. I always order tom kha soup at thai places and this was by far the most bland I've had. They also need more help answering phones and seating people.

I have to say this is my favorite restaurant in all of Las Vegas! Love the food...especially the Mongolian beef and Mongolian tofu! Been going here for at least 7 years and don't think I will stop anytime soon.

We were very eager to try this restaurant out after seeing how moist and saucy their noodle dishes looked in other yelper's pictures. The reviews also seemed like this place wouldn't disappoint.

What started off as a positive experience, slowly and annoyingly became a long & drawn out waste of our time. 

After 30 minutes of waiting for our food, I became drawn in and aware of the time - I was starving! I saw that there were tables that were seated after us, receiving their food, I suppose it's because they were appetizers? I couldn't tell. I was still annoyed and very hungry. 

I kept looking at the time and it had soon become 35 minutes, yet still no food. At this point I was very antsy, hungry, and aggravated. My soda has watered down a lot at this point (I like to drink it fizzy with my meal.)

45 minutes later, our food arrived. We asked the server if they could be so understanding to swap out my coke for a fresh one, since I hadn't even drink it yet and it had gone flat since we waited so long for the food to come out. The waiter didn't understand, he thought we wanted a coconut water - so he got the manager involved. The manager listened to our concern and request, but he said that they don't do that here and that our request was unusual. So we just had to say - ok thanks, never mind then.

It's just a simple coke - we were agitated about the extensive wait, my watered down coke that was clearly not drank from, but they weren't concerned about our complaints. He was polite and professional - but I still feel slapped for the whole experience. It wasted our time and not once did our server or any server come out to explain the long wait for our food or check on us. 

Although, we requested spice level 7, it was really a level 1. We asked 3 times for a chili tray to be refreshed as the chilies were gone - 3 different servers later, brought the chili tray. We also asked for lemons 2 times in a row, the second person finally brought it for us. There were a lot of servers but no one wanted to help our table. Our food was getting cold as were were waiting for these things.

The positive things I could take from this place was that the noodles were moist, the pad kee mao had nice flavor, and the pad thai (although bland) was a massive portion - I feel like it was at least 4 portions that they brought out, which is a good deal. 

Yet, I wasn't a fan about the horrible service.  If I ever feel inclined to come back, I would order take out instead.

My search for a no fail and delicious thai restaurant close to home continues.

I hate that i am writing a one star review but for this location its a must. I have been a long time Archi's fan back years and years when they first started here in Las Vegas. 
Everytime I seem to come to this location either the food is bad or the service is bad. 

Today for our lunch break my boyfriend and I decided to give this place another try. Bad idea.  I walked in and got seated by some server who seemed to have an attitude. We waited about 20 minutes before we were greeted by a busser asking what we wanted to drink. We asked her to order food as well and she told us she had to get our server.
15 minutes later finally a server came over and took our order. The food took forever to come out but the food was actually good though. The whole process took an hour and a half which in my opinion is very lengthy not to mention IT MADE ME LATE BACK TO WORK! 

Of course, when it came time to pay they were super fast on picking up my credit card.

The sad part was we werent the only table that was complaining.

I have been searching for years to find great pad thai here in Summerlin.....Done!  I have yet to dine in but it looks really nice.

I do the pick up option and the portion is do big I can have half for lunch and the rest for dinner!  Not bad for $8.  

Hoping to go in one of these days.

I didn't even like Thai food until I started going here.  I wonder if they secretly add some kind of crack to this food because I crave it fortnightly.  Sooo good.  

My favorite is the Pad Kapow (spicy basil), Pad Thai, and the chicken fried rice is the.best.ever.  It is seriously amazing.  Yes, I know that's a "boring" dish.  I order it for my kids and wind up eating whatever they don't finish.  It's even better the next day.

We usually get take out but the actual restaurant is wonderful.  I love the plantation shutters everywhere.  The staff is friendly, although not always fluent in English.  I love this place.  I hope they don't change their business model any time soon.
I like Archi's pad thai and pad see ew...especially because they use chinese broccoli. The south rainbow location is good too.

Their food is the best out of all the places i been Thai'ing it up! I always have their Chicken Panang Curry and Chicken Pad Ke Mow and for apps the thai spring rolls! Very delicious and spicy. Dont forget the mango sticky rice!!

Excellent food!  The ambiance is also lovely and clean.  Love all their curries and the best of all is the Pad Thai.  Service is usually very good.  THe most wonderful thing is their lunch menu!  Same delicous food but in large portion (single item only served with egg roll and soup).  A great value.  We will keep returning.
Mine and my husbands default place for food. I get the same thing every time and love it: spicey basil with chicken.

3 words: YELLOW CHICKEN CURRY. The curry is not a paste thick sort but rather a mixture of  sweet and spicy yumness! The spices in this dish are not overwhelming at all and they provide a taste like no other. Like most curry dishes you have to choose a spicy range from 1 to 10. I love spicy food and let me tell ya, 7 is pushing it but I've tried 8 and while it is very spicy, you can still taste well enough to enjoy the dish. So far everything I've tried has been delicious from Pork Phad Thai to their Tofu soup to Tom Kha Shrimp. If I had anything bad to say about Archi's it would be that their fried rice is mediocre, I've most definitely had better fried rice before, but its not terrible- just bland.  Make sure to try the Thai Tea with your meal- DELICIOUS! :)

For some reason this location is hidden away like some redheaded step child. Its a tiny location in the Village Square shopping center, but once you find it and go inside you will find a warm and friendly environment. This location is always clean and ready to serve. The staff is so friendly- I once picked up some take out and  the waitress offered me a drink  while I waited (which wasn't long).

When my youngest son and his fiancee brought me here yesterday for Lunch... I thought to myself as I walked in.... "I've been here before... but when?". They tried to bring me here last year when I was visiting, but Archi's Thai was closed that day... They took me to another place... and was extremely disappointed. As you can see by the rating, Archi's was a pleasant surprise and very good Thai cuisine... judging by the Lunch Specials.

As I told the kids... Archi's is deserving of 5-Stars for the sampling of the Lunch Special... and if the Dinners were as good and consistent as the Lunch Special that I had.

Atmosphere is most unlike Southeastern Asian.... The decor is set in medium dark woods... furniture is French Provincial in style... pictures are, surprisingly, of Thailands French Colonial days with framed pictures of their former Royalty in Thailand of days gone by. You will be surprised by this atmosphere... a little of French Colonial in an Asian restaurant.

On the menu....

Tom Yum Soup (**** Complimentary) Lemongrass, Lime Leaves and Blue Ginger infused Broth, Mushrooms, Tomatoes and Lime Juice... sprinkled with Cilantro and Green Onions. For a smallish 3" diameter cup / bowl... this Soup could be considered Thailand's version of Chinese Hot and Sour Soup. Dang good... but left me wanting more... but it's complimentary.

Lunch Special #4 - Red Curry Dish with Beef (***** $6.95 Shrimp-$7.95) Fresh Red Curry Paste in Coconut Milk with Zucchini, Bamboo Shoots (a lot of 'em), Basil, and Bell Peppers. 

When you order this... the wait-staff will ask you the degree of Hot-ness that you want your Soup (from 1 to 10... with 1 being a lack of Heat and 10 being Super Hot)... I was considering ordering the Soup with a 10... My son and his fiancee looked at me quizzically or amazingly. They really tried to convince me to reconsider.... I tried this tactic... I asked the waitress... "If you ordered this, what number would you order?" She replied with a 6. So, I compromised.... 8.

When the Soup came out, The Soup was accompanied by a very small Green Salad which was totally inconsequential considering it's size; a Thai Egg Roll (***)... I really don't like totally Veggie Egg Rolls, and a thinly fried Won-Ton (****). This was just a small sampling of from their extensive menu.

The Red Curry Soup was something else altogether... As you travel West across SouthEast Asia... you'll notice that the Asian countries will be more influence by Indian Cuisine as you travel. This Soup was silky smooth from the Coconut Milk and the Red Curry gave it a warm color and unique flavor that only Curry can impose. Coconut based Soups are some of my very favorite. If I had to penalize the Soup for any reason, it would be for the amount of Bamboo Shoots... just too much. Otherwise, something you should try whether it be a Lunch Special or at Dinner.

Lunch Special #5 - Spicy Basil Dish with Beef (***** $6.95) Stir Fried with Zucchini, Bell Peppers, Garlic, Chili and Fresh Basil. This was a sampling that my son's fiancee obligingly gave me to try.

A very delicious Stir-Fry with Ground Beef. I will try this next time... whenever that may be.

Wait-Staff was very friendly, helpful. I asked the waitress how the smallish chain came to be named Archi's... She said Archi was the nickname of the owner, who started his restaurants seven years ago. This location started up two years ago taking over a Pick-Up-Stix franchise that went bust. She also said the owner usually is at the Rainbow location ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/archis-thai-kitchen-and-thai-bistro-las-vegas ) since that was the original restaurant and is quite larger in size.

One other advantage of this location is the proximity to my favorite Cinema in Las Vegas... the Regal Village Square 18 ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/regal-village-square-18-las-vegas ). Archi's would be a good pre or post movie visit.

BTW, Archi's has been rated the Best of Las Vegas 2005-2007.
I love this place!!! My favorite place to get pad Thai. My husband & I come here at least once a week.

Our go to Thai restaurant .. Nice decor / great service / right next to the movie theatre. They are closed one day of the week can't remember if it's tues or wed .. Great lunch special deal . Fabulous soups and red curry
Yummy!! The Pork Larb and Chicken Curry fried rice were delicious. The Spicy Basil was meh. But my family thoroughly enjoyed the experience. We can't wait to come back.

Garlic pepper beef!! Yes please!!! One of my favorite Thai restaurants when I'm in town. Wish I could magically appear whenever I get the Thai bug, Sacramento is LACKING! If you are in the mood for good Thai in Archis is a must!

A friend who's very critical of food establishments told me this place was good so it's got that going for it. I've only been once but would definitely recommend it. I got the Pad Thai lunch special which was a good deal. They give you a regular sized portion of the noodles as well as soup and a salad. 

The servers are super nice and attentive. I'll be back to try out some curries!
Excellent quality and flavorful cuisine.   The beef salad was so delicious!  The portions are also good and the prices are just right.  I will definitely eat here again.

This is a great lunch spot. I wouldn't get too crazy by saying you will have an authentic experience but you will leave satisfied. The spice levels are a bit low so you might consider kicking it up a notch like your buddy Emeril.

Archi's always delivers! This was my first time at this location and I gotta say I like the other locations better. This one is much bigger (read- more busy/crowded) and the service left something to be desired. But once we dropped a hint the main guy, things went alot more smoothly. HIGHLY recommend the red curry and the papaya salad. Just a warning the salad was WAAY spicier than I expected, so be conserved on the level you ask for. Also got the flat noodles with chicken- pretty solid. I highly recommend Archi's to anyone and everyone!
Love the food but not at 90 degrees. I sweated the whole time and was ignored when I asked if they could make it cooler. Sorry, Not coming back.

After having a bad take out dinner at Basil and Lime down the street... I have to apologize to Archi's for not giving them an excellent review since I've been going here for a few years. It's time to give them props.  Tom Yum - right amount of spice and sourness, pineapple fried rice awesoooome, Pad Thai yum yum, Panang Curry so delish, Pad See Saw - I guess that's what its called also perfection.  Props to this chain great food, I won't cheat on you again, only did it cuz you close on Tuesdays.... why Thai food is good any day in my book.
I've been a regular here and always get the pad Thai or their curry dishes. I wish I had know of yelp! since I had my iPhone!
Pretty great tasting place, they do take time to get you your order. Some of the best Thai food I've had. Its right across the street from me so when I'm hungry this is my go to place.

Came here for dinner. Geez, no one bothered to greet us, seat us or act like we existed. Waited long enough & finally gave up & left.  Take your business & eat where they welcome customers. These people could care less

Voted best in Las Vegas for 10 yrs for a reason! Always fresh, always professional. We usually order at least once a week. Everytime we come inside we always think how CLEAN everything is and how nice. We are always greeted warmly and the wait is never too long. Archies makes it easy and what's not to love!

I love Archi's 

I highly recommend the seafood pancake! I don't think they list this on their menu... I'm not sure why but I heard about it from my mom and it is amazing! 

Don't leave without having the sticky rice and coconut ice cream either ^.^ 

Only down side... the service was slow. It was busy so I know it can get crazy trying to take care of all the tables but we didn't get a single refill and tried to flag the waitress down like three times before we were able to get her attention.

Update: Not happy! On 5.17.2015 I dined in the restaurant with a friend and the male waiter ran my card at the wrong table, then proceeded to run my card for my check for the full amount when we paid half cash. He brought it to me to sign and I called him out on it. He went back and ran he it for the correct amount, but I'm pissed. Who does that??? You ran my card at the wrong table?!? Not okay!  Then took my cash and ran my card for the full amount... Not okay!!! They should have offered my meal free or discounted. I eat there at least 3 times a month. I'm very disappointed and upset! I'll be attaching a photo from my bank statement showing all 3 charges that are still pending on my account. 

Update: I really love this place! I've tried other Thai restaurants and I have yet to find one that is better than Archi's. The Yellow curry is my favorite. I've inly eaten inside the restaurant maybe 2-3 times. We typically order takeout.

I forgot how good Archi's is. I tried once about a year and a half ago with family. The Sahara location isn't anywhere near me but it was a good central spot for a family meet. 
The staff is always friendly and welcoming. 
I had the Thai tea to start. It was very good. Not too sweet and not too strong.
I love pad Thai and I love it HOT! So when I ordered my chicken pad Thai at a 10 the waiter was surprised and confirmed the spice level. He also confirmed that there was peanuts and egg in the dish. I thought was a great idea for any food allergy people. I've never had a restaurant do that. 
I also got the Tom Kha soup. Great flavor and the coconut milk made it a little creamy too. The serving is enough for 2-3 people to split if you're ordering as an appetizer.

We frequent this location whenever we want to see a movie at Village Square.  They have expanded their seating recently so the wait isnt too bad.  Tasty chow mein and soups.  The papaya salad is also good.  Food comes out in a timely fashion, and they are good to hurry your order up if you are pressed for time to get to your movie.

Archi's is definitely my go-to Thai food place. I've been coming here since it opened and replaced my beloved Pick Up Stix. I LOVE their pad thai and can live off of it for days. A few other favorites are the Sweet and Sour chicken and Masaman curry. I eat here about once a week and the only thing I don't love is the consistency of the service. It's always the same handful of workers and sometimes they are fabulous and sometimes they just drop our plates on the corner of the table and walk away. I still love the food and just order it to go to avoid the chance that the service might not be as good that night.

I love the mint chicken dish with Thai Tea. Mmm.
If you are a spicy food lover. You have to give them a shot. Save room for dessert because that rice ice cream dessert thing is delicious. I just cannot remember what it's called!!

Archie's is delicious, the beef curry fried rice spicy 10 can't be beat. The portion size is extremely large and cost is affordable this ratio is why it is a must eat place in Las Vegas. Food taste fresh and it has the right amount of spice along with flavor.

The service has its hit and misses, normally though they get it right ... I think twice out of a dozen times I had to wait roughly an hour for my food. My girl friend and I learned its easy to call and order it to go and enjoy the food at home while watching a movie. The space went under a remodel giving additional (much needed) space so wait times for a table are next to nothing when we go to dine in. 

Can't compare if to other Thai restaurants as this is my first Thai restaurant, but I do enjoy their food and believe they have set the bar high. Their food is good, menu has options for everyone, atmosphere is comfortable, service is okay could be slightly better, portion to size ratio AMAZING... so Give them a try you too may enjoy what they have to offer.

I really love Archie's Thai Kitchen. My husband and I have been going to the Flamingo location for years.. We normally order the Pad Woon Sen, the beef fried rice and the wonton soup which is incredible..
We have had unpleasant experiences here at this location several times now. It is closer to our house than the Flamingo or Rainbow location so we really wanted it to be more convenient for us. Sadly enough, every time we go here our order comes out wrong. We order a spicy number 6 and no spice is added, we order a spicy number 4 and it burns our heads off. We don't run into this problem at any other location. 
We have also been to this location and it is super busy and their is no one to help us sit or order food. 
New management is needed here. They really need to change these things. I would love to frequent this restaurant but find that it is hard to trust that our food will be done consistently.
I eat here at least once a week. Basil fried rice, beef salad, and the pad see ew is my usual order. This place is a must go.
