Stopped in for lunch today and three of us sat down to enjoy Thai food.  An order of Suki Hang  came with a well cooked, well seasoned whole napkin in the middle of the food.  No idea if the napkin had been used by the cook to wipe his nose or wipe his brow, etc.  The waitress apologized and went to the kitchen to have another order prepared.  The waitress returned in a few minutes to let us know the owner was contacted and allowed for no charge on that one order.  The manager on duty and the owner never came to the table to offer an apology, instead they allowed the waitress to handle the situation.  The incident caused all of us to lose our appetite when we considered what the napkin had been used for and how it made it into the food.  A totally disgusting situation and we have eaten at this restaurant previously and had one other incident of food not being prepared properly.  Look before you eat your meal at this restaurant!

Archi's Thai Cafe changed my outlook on Thai food.

I've never had good experiences at the Thai places I've been to in the past, which pretty much made me avoid Thai restaurants in general.  All I remember are "bean sprouts" and "peanuts" - LOTS of them.

So I was a little reluctant to try Archi's, but am SO GLAD that I DID.  Can't believe I waited this long.  Their chicken pad thai is so good and their chicken fried rice is bomb. I was pleasantly surprised to see that not everything is bean sprouts and peanuts!  

We ordered those 2 dishes, an eggplant dish and a Thai iced tea which came out to be ~$40 including tax.  I wasn't too thrilled with the eggplant, it was a little bitter and harder than what I'm used to.  The serving portions are fairly large and we pretty much ended up taking 75% of the food home.  Yeah, pretty ridiculous that we ordered that much food for lunch, but they served as nice leftovers :)

I would DEFINITELY go here again.  They also do take-out!  There are a few locations so make sure you call the right one to place your order!

Woohoo!  It's Friday night.  You know what that means.  Mommy's off kitchen duty.  ;)  Time for takeout!  I had a craving for Thai so we turned to yelp for a recommendation.  We ordered the Tom Yum soup, Pad Thai, and Panang curry.  We ordered spicy level 5 for all three but the soup was spicier than a 5.  Maybe more like a 7-8.  The pad thai and panang curry were pretty good.  I wish the curry had more a bit more curry...didn't seem to have much liquid but I liked how it had green beans.  When we ordered they told us it'd be 30 minutes.  Hubby went to pick it up after 30 minutes and he still had to wait another 10-15 minutes.  While he was waiting he spoke to a few other patrons who were waiting to be seated/pick up their orders and many of them said they've often had to wait an additional 30 minutes to pick up their orders.  And he said the place was packed with maybe six tables worth of people waiting to be seated.  I guess dinner options in Summerlin are pretty limited.  I think the food is worthy of a 3.5.  I'm going to give it another try and reevaluate.

Never been disappointed here--dinner and lunch specials always hot & fresh at a good price.  The fried tofu appetizers are crispy delights, their panang or red curry dishes are savory, the stuffed chicken wings amazing (how do they get so much stuffing in there?).  Servers are attentive and friendly.

After having tried various Thai restaurants around Vegas we had finally arrived at Archi's.  Let me just say that we should have tried here first. 

Ate the Panang Curry, fried tofu, and broccoli. Way more than enough for two and much much better service than lotus of siam. If you're in the mood for Thai then this is the place.
Such great food ! Big portions, awesome environment. That are always very fast and the flavors are just beyond this world ! Keep it up!!!

Food: 
Pad Thai with tofu 8/10
Amazing pad Thai!!!
Tofu Panang with brown rice 8/10
Delicious Panang!!!

Service:
Took a little long but that's okay they were a little busy I def understand. Saw us a couple times trying to get a check,not a biggie at all.

Cleanliness:
WOW, the wall I was sitting by, food particles everywhere. Above us was a hanging light, dust all over it. A/C vent, dust all around it blowing that crap who knows where. One of the services sneezed in his hands then wiped it on his apron then served food. The lady expo coughed on her hands, texting on her phone, then prepped food and put her hands on the plate. Absolutely disgusting. Not the Restaurants fault because I'm 100% they go through servsafe for this kind of stuff. Unbelievable, please attend to your employees.

Archi's has the best Pad Thai. The food is consistently good, unlike some other Thai restaurants in town. The beef salad is always great and refreshing; and has a modest proportion of beef for the price. The curry is creamy and not overwhelming with a perfect blend of spices and goes great with the pineapple fried rice. I've tried plenty of Thai restaurants in town, but definitely keep Archi's as my top pick.

We've been sitting here for half an hour so far and have received just tea. They recently expanded but don't seem to have the help to cover the additional seating. Seem more concerned with their to go orders than their restaurant patrons. Pity.

I really thought the food was good but just a little underwhelming.  Beef salad was actually very tasty but there was a definite lack of juice that accompanies the dish.  Hubbs ordered chicken pad thai, was lacking in a little acidity but it was not bad.  Again, the food was okay, but nothing fabulous.  On the plus side, portions were generous.The only weird thing was that we both ordered #6 spice to our dishes and my husband's dish was about 2 levels under my spice.  I really think mine was the true 6 ;) .  I hope it wasn't done on purpose after they took one look at the whiteboy and decided to underplay the spice request.  We did not attempt dessert because the service was way too slow.  I want to give it another try sometime but maybe during  lunch.

Ate here for the first time and I will say I that I am very pleased with the food. For appetizers we ordered the won tons and the satay chicken skewers with peanut sauce, both were very good. My entrée was the red curry w/bamboo shoots and rice. It was DELICIOUS! My boyfriend ordered a ground chicken dish, I don't remember the name of his, but it was delicious, as well. 

I would have given them 5 stars, but we were with another couple and first they brought out our appetizers without bringing theirs and then they brought out our entrees without bringing out theirs, so we felt obligated, out of courtesy, to wait about 5-7 minutes for the rest of our party to be served first before we could eat. I didn't like that my food was just sitting there. Yes, I know I could have just started eating, but most restaurants serve everyone at the same time. Also, they serve the soda in cans, so there are no refills. I don't like when restaurants do that. However, the food was good enough for me to return.
I come here at least once a week. Delicious food with very quick service. Great for take outs too. I highly recommend this place.
Thai food has been a new obsession for me. We've been getting take out every week for a while now and Archie's is fantastic!  Food always tastes fresh service is fast.

Amazing food! 

However, service is not always that great. I came in once, by myself, and the waiter kept looking at me like a fool.. after about a good minute, I asked to be seated, clearly making him look like a fool, he was a douche the whole time. Second time I go, this time with someone, waitress was just apathetic.

This has the best Panang Curry I have ever tried. I don't how they make it so much better than any of the other Thai places I've been to before.  Also, make sure you try their curry fried rice (make it spicy is even better). You can't go wrong at eating here.

This is my favorite Thai restaurant in the whole city! Due to its popularity there is usually a bit of a wait for dinner, so be prepared. When we go we usually get the pad see ew, fried rice, pad won sen or any of the curries. I'm not a big fan of their soups but everything else on the menu has not been a disappointment.

Archie's is a Thai restaurant chain with locations convenient to both my work and home. I love their lunch specials for the good portions and value. I would recommend their Pad Thai lunch and Kung Pao chicken (better than Chinese kung pao). They serve consistently good Thai food with my only complaint being the spice number is not consistent. I've asked for spicy number 5s that may be more like a three on some days and like a nine on others. Yikes! But it's so good, I'll eat it anyway. I would suggest not getting the salads or the soups too spicy because the spice tends to overwhelm these dishes. Better to add more spice later than be sorry. Besides the lunch specials,  a few other favorite dishes of mine are the Panang curry, Massaman curry and Tom Kha Gai soup. If in season, try the mango and sticky rice for dessert. Love it!

Always consistently good. It isn't the fastest service, but the food is delicious, the restaurant is clean, the staff is friendly. We just don't come if we are in a hurry or we get take out. Can't compare it to other Thai, because we are always pleased and don't feel the need to go elsewhere.

My go to spot for curry and pad thai in my neighborhood. There are very few places that I visit on a consistent basis that make me as happy as a trip to Archi's does. It is my guilty pleasure without the guilt.

Lets start off with my favorite dishes. 

The yellow chicken curry is a balancing act of perfection. A carnival of different flavors melded together to make one kickass curry. Throw in some potatoes, onions, and carrots with whatever meat you desire and you have a hearty delicious meal on your hands. Choose your desired spicy level, give me a side of rice, and I'm done!

Now the pad thai is easily one of the best pad thais I've ever had. It is not some fancy rendition of pad thai with overcomplicated ingredients or an unnecessary presentation. It's pad thai, with a side of chopped peanuts and baby sprouts. That is it. It does not need to be more than that.

I will say that not all dishes are created equal at Archi's. Their fried rice is just not that well put together. It looks delicious but it just really falls short on the flavor department. And another shortcoming of Archi's is their inconsistant spice level. I usually order a spicy level of seven but it will vary wildly from mouth scorcher to somewhat mild. I think it depends on who is preparing it but make sure to keep that in mind when ordering.

Despite the complaints, Archi's still goes down in my book as a solid place to get some pad thai or curry.

Ate here with my girlfriend this evening. She had the Mongolian entree and I had the Pad Cha Cha Cha entree. Both were excellent.

We've also eaten here once before and had no complaints that time either.

Service was prompt and friendly.

We'll definitely be back again.

First time here and will definitely come back. Food was delicious and pad Thai was amaaaaazing. We ordered sweet sour pork, chicken pad Thai and beef curry all spicy 6. It wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be. Definitely the proportions are bigger and better then Pin kaow (located on rainbow and lake mead). I would recommend to just get an entree because for a dollar more, you get more food than the lunch size ones. I love their decor and their friendly staff. I would definitely recommend it to any food lovers out there!

Been living here in Las Vegas for almost two years now and have not found a great Thai cuisine place with decent prices off of the strip until I ran into this place. The food is very flavorful and great! Pricing is not sky high it's just right. 5 stars for friendly staff and great food. Decor and atmosphere is nice a cozy inside. Come get one of the best pad thai in town. And your option of spicy level 1-10 is absolutely awesome! Finally found my go to for Thai cuisine from now on!

I will never ever ever eat here again for as long as I live!!!!!!!   My brothers thought it'd be a good idea to take me here for dinner since I lived in AZ and there is no thai restaurants in my town.   They had been here before and said it was really good.  But OMG it was a big mistake.  about an hour after we ate here we just started vomiting and we got severe diarrhea that lasted for 3 straight days.  I mean it was non stop, so severe in fact that on the first night I slept on the bathroom floor next to the toilet.   I know it was this food that made us very ill....   This is why I don't recommend this restaurant to anyone, cuz I have nothing good to say about it.  Even our waitress was so rude that night.       "EAT HERE AT YOUR OWN RISK."....   This place traumatized me so, that i'm afraid of going to eat thai food.   This place SUCKED!!!!!

I am not really a Thai food enthusiast; however, my boyfriend is and I have heard great things about this place so I wanted to give it a try. The place was very busy during lunch hour but we were immediately seated. We both ordered $6.95 Lunch specials which is really a great deal of food for the price. His red curry was fantastic! My Kung Pao chicken was just ok. All the other food with the meal was delicious. I will go back again but will stick with ordering curry.

Disappointed with the service, we came in ,5 employees ignored us to seat us down. Asked for soy sauce she said yaa we have! Never got it! Asked another lady and she ignored us, I was like what is going on here.... Wanted to leave right away but I couldn't cause she took for ever to get me the bill ! Wow . I usually, when I got the bill I got charged for two ice teas two Thai ice teas one soft drink extra, all we ordered and got was ice teas wow keeps getting worst by the minute. I will never ever come back!! I'm pissed! I
Loved pad kea mow....it's the best I have ever tried. We do come here for pad kea mow  ever other day for lunch....

Not authentic!! I was very fooled by the pictures I order pad see ew.. I expect Chinese Broccoli due to what the previous Yelp pictures showed it did not look the same it also had no flavor and the noodles are very mushy definitely not fresh noodles and to top that they had very bad customer service which I was going to let pass but for the food to not be good I had to leave a review.
Archis is was one of the better Thai food restaurants in Vegas. I've been going here for years. I usually get the Penang, Thai beef salad, pad kea mow. Can't go wrong with any of those.
The Tom Kha soup was amazing. We will be back soon! The atmosphere was quiet and felt traditional. It also appeared to be family run which I think makes for better food.

I was very disappointed in my visit today. From looking at other's reviews, it seems like Archi's takeout service is horrible. I can definitely agree. When I called this afternoon, no one picked up the phone. I called again and placed my order at 1:17. The lady said she will "see me in 25 minutes." We got there at 1:44. The food should have been ready by then, right? We waiting until almost 2:15 to get our food.. I placed my order almost an hour ago. My boyfriend had to wave down a server 3-4 times. I ordered spicy level 4 and 5 on my dishes and they were not spicy at all. Portions were lacking for paying over 10 dollars for 1 pad thai dish. I've dined in here before and it actually replaced Thai Style Noodle House for a while. Don't think I will be coming back though.
Great place. The food here is wonderful at a great price. The only Thai in summerlin with a 4 star in my book

Really solid restaurant. The service is great and so is the food. If it had the option I would rate it as a 4.5. The reason not a five is because its great but its also not the absolute best I have had. I would say it is authentic and I would highly recommend!
Yummy!!! Had the panang curry and pad ke mao noodles 7/10 spicy and they made it vegetarian for us! Delicious found a fav by the house.

Normally I would say that Archies is one of my favorite Thai food places, but this time was not as pleasant. I walked in to a busy atmosphere and it took one of the girls walking by me three times before I was greeted. I place my order at 1:23 for just basic pad Thai and some red curry.... After patiently waiting, at about 1:55 she says it's coming out in just a minute. Finally my food is here and I can go enjoy it at home, well the pad Thai was great as usual, but I've been having bad experiences with curry lately so I'm always extra careful when eating it... And of course there it was, a giant, black, wavy piece of hair, I almost puked. I couldn't believe it, I'm literally still in shock as I'm writing this review! I didn't pay 23$ plus tip for food with nasty hair in it! I just don't know if there are any decent Thai food restaurants left in this town, so discouraging.

We love the food here! The pad Thai never disappoints. The lunch special is the best deal ever. Huge portions. BUT... DON'T ORDER A SODA at this location. They bring you out a glass of ice and a can of soda... NO REFILLS and it's $1.95. Crazy to pay that for a can of soda. The Thai tea is delicious and it's $3.95. No refills but comes in a big glass.

i wasnt as impressed as i thought i would be. The food was good but i think I was expecting more based on the great reviews. I didn't care for the fresh spring roll, it was not like any other fresh spring rolls I've ever had. It was more like a sausage roll with some veggies and glass noodles rolled in a dough. The silver noodle salad medium spicy was good.
Huge portions, great tasting food, and very good service. I will be back again.

Should definitely try the stuffed chicken wings ! The soup is very authentic. Not overly sweetened like all the other Thai restaurants trying to make it tailor to customers other than Thai. Very authentic I would say.

This is good Thai-American style food. Service is fast and good, prices are right and it is clean, and tidy.  We were a party of 3 and ordered 3 dishes to split. All were good but the green beans and fried tofu with basil was very yummy. They gave us an ample amount of rice and a hot sauce that was actually hot! The spring roll was fresh and flavorful, but the brown sauce they served it with was uninspiring. I prefer a more authentic taste of Thai, but this place is good.
I actually love Thai food and have tried so many Thai restaurants. Archie's has its select dishes that are absolutely delectable. Including the choochee I think that's what it's called amazing!

My favorite Thai place in town. I've been here many times over the past few years and it never ever disappoints.

The service is usually very good and the servers are very attentive.

The yellow curry is by far my favorite and the best curry in town I think. The chicken and seafood varieties are very good although I prefer the seafood.

Their pad Thai is also very good and the fish cake app is amazing.

Oh Archi's.  What has happened to ye?

I used to love and frequent this place often, but then went through a phase where I just wasn't feeling the Thai vibe.  Recently, though, I got a craving for some red curry.  I could just taste that flavorful goodness as we drove down to the restaurant.  My husband was excited about the Pad Kea Mow.

Unfortunately, I was disappointed in my grand comeback to this former go-to spot of mine.  

- The service was terrible.  We waited almost 20 minutes for someone to come and take our order.  I felt so bad for the couple next to us, hidden in a corner.  The staff completely forgot about them back there and the husband had to go ask the hostess TWICE to send over a waiter.  Maybe it's because it was a Monday holiday (President's Day) and they didn't expect such a big crowd?

- The prices had increased.  One of the things I loved about Archi's was their price point.  It's still moderately priced, but it was still disappointing to see the increase.

- My beloved curry (spiciness level 3) was over spiced and over powering.  The beef was overcooked and tough.  The Pad Kea Mow (also a level 3), on the other hand, was bland and had no spice to it!

Ohhhhhh Archi's.  Of course I'll come back and try again because I love you so much, but I really hope this isn't the end of our relationship.
The food here is really good.  The fried rice and pad Thai is excellent.  Having said that,  we had to ask for someone to take our food order. Really?  Take out is highly recommended .

Below average.  Use to be good, but now they just toss stuff together.  Too much spice ( turmeric) in one dish.  The other dish -papaya salad tasted a few days old.
I won't be returning.
Try Natalie Thai.
We love Archi's for dining in or taking out! Our go-to is the Basil rice, panang curry, yellow curry, and drunken noodles. They never disappoint and the service has always been great

pretty good place.  my father would rate this place a four star, he is here every moment that he can get to eat. i luv it because it is clean and it is good for family gathering. If you get a chance to eat here and love seaqfood try as an entree the tom yum soup (sea food mix). It will be good enough for four or more people to eat. Also, most their plates can feed more than two. check it out!!!
The  spicy chicken thai basil is delicious and their lunch special can't be beat!
Very good Thai food and reasonable prices. My spice level was a 2 which was plenty for me, husband got a 5 which was a bit too much for him. Pad Thai and spring rolls were my favorite dishes.

We love this place! The service is always fast and the people are nice. The food and prices are excellent. We've tried a lot of items on the menu and everything has been good. The tom yum soup is fantastic.

First time trying Archie's. We were in the area and we found it strictly based on Yelp reviews.

Really enjoyed the atmosphere and the service was extremely attentive!

I personally enjoyed the Pineapple Chicken Curry a lot. Chicken had lots of flavor and was cooked perfectly.

My wife had the Chicken Chow Mein (and I must agree) it was very bland and lacked any type of seasoning.

Our biggest issue was the "Fresh Spring Rolls" which are a signature of any good Thai restaurant. These had a very doughy wrap and felt more like vegetable sushi rolls. Once again, no seasoning or signature flavor at all. The peanut sauce was extremely tame and didn't add much.  Did not enjoy these at all (mainly because of the wrap)

I wanted to give Archie's five stars right when we walked in... It's a beautiful spot. But it wouldn't be the truth after eating the food.

I have heard many people rave about archie's and I agree!.  I was unaware of how close this place is to my home, which is definitely a plus!

Food: Variety of options with lunch specials served on weekdays (except for holidays) that are reasonably priced.  We came on the weekend so I did not have an option of trying these.  My husband and I started with the stuffed wings appetizer.  5/5 YUMMY!  I had the red curry with shrimp 5/5.  Flavor and spice spot on #6 spice level very tolerable.  My husband had the yellow curry with chicken spice level #5, equally tasty!  I prefer things more on the spicy side so next time I'll try #8  I love how the rice soaks up the juice from the sauce!

Service: decent.  Not over the top.  We did wait a bit for our bill, but nothing to complain about.

Overall I would recommend and will be back to try other things on the menu!

Unlike the other Archi's Thai restaurants in Vegas, this one is very very close to my home. This is a very dangerous thing!

I get, exclusively, the Chicken Panang Curry because it is delicious. I use Archi's Panang Curry as my bar to which other Thai food is compared.

Pro-tip: they'll ask you if you want spicy level 1-10. If you're a fan of spicy food, it actually goes to 30 (in increments of 5 after 10). I get the 30. It's good. At the one on S. Rainbow a 30 is *incredibly* and inedibly hot for me. Here, however, it's only *incredibly* hot, and thus edible. Different Archi's have different levels once you venture into the land beyond the 1-10 scale. Tread lightly. Work your way up.

Lots of times when people say they like Thai food that sometimes means their talking about the Pad Thai. lol I'm one of them~
Anyways I love coming here EVERYTIME I eat here I am satisfied and happy. 
Service-excellent fill up my drink all the time and food comes out fast
food- oh yes. hmm....spicy eggplant. yes try it. try try try. any food that comes out of their kitchen is the bomb. It might be a illogical fallacy but whatevs. Archis make good food all the time ;deal with it

Hands down the best Thai Restarunt in Las vegas, definitely worth checking out if u love Thai food, the portion sizes are good, great location, with great prices. Customer services is good. It can be better but I don't mind it because the food is execellente

Waited for about 10-15 minutes. Order the food, and waited for about 1 hour before the food came. During the waiting for food, the server never stopped by to give updates or anything. Food is good but not great. Ordered Fried Egg on the side, came cold. Server told me that she will get a new one. 30 seconds later with the same egg that I cut in half soggy... They must put it in microwave.
Service: 3/5
Wait Time: 1/5
Food Quality: 2/5

Oh so disappointed. Everyone raves about this place so we finally tried it and were let down. We were seated in the corner and totally forgotten about. We ordered the tom yum soup and it was bland and barely had anything in it. It was more like a bowl of broth. The masaman was watery and flavorless. In my opinion they cant compare to Pin Kaow on Lake Mead and Rainbow.

Horrible customer service.  My husband placed a to-go order and I went to pick it up.  Paid, left a 3.00 tip on a 12.92 order, ordered pad thai.  Got all the way home and my husband was calling me telling me they sent me home with the WRONG order and I needed to go back.  I went back and asked how I was going to be compensated.  She either had no idea what I was asking or was playing dumb.  She offered me a tea "to make me happy."  I went 20 minutes out of my way, gave a $3.00 tip on a to-go order and SHE screwed up and offers up a tea.  Our business will be taken else where.

As a lover of Masaman curry, I've been trying a lot of places to try and find the best one.  At around 10 dollars (including tax) I'd say their beef masaman curry is well worth the money.  It's definitely not the best.  My favorite so far would be Komol's (in Sahara) but this is a good alternative considering I live in Summerlin.  The reason I don't think theirs was as good was because the beef pieces were "sliced" (as opposed to chunks of beef like at Komol) and the potato wasn't cooked as thoroughly as I'd like (it was still kind of hard).  The service was subpar.

One of the Best Thai Restaurants in town.

Let me start off by saying I have been to all of the Archies locations and this is by far the best and most consistent. The interior is beautiful and the wait staff is very friendly. But if your like me and order take-out then prepare to suffer through ordering because one of the kitchen staff normally answers the phone and lets just say Ixnay on the English. But for the quality and price of the food you cannot beat it. 

I normally order the Chicken Satay and to be honest there have been times when this has been overcooked. But only when I phone in an order. And I can honestly say it's only been twice in 30 some odd visits. The peanut sauce is my favorite out of all the Thai places I've tried. Also on the appetizer front is Beef Jerky which comes with a light citrus sauce. I dont care for Thai Jerky on a norm but theirs is good. 

For the entrée my norm is Pad Ka Pow (Spicy Basil) Beef. It is ground beef in a spicy chili basil sauce with sliced bell pepper and zucchini. Seriously, it is without a doubt my favorite dish of theirs. The meat is so spicy and flavorful. It always clears the sinuses. If I'm not feeling Ka Pow on a certain night than I get Pad Thai. Their Pad Thai has a fresh taste to it. And while I enjoy shrimp Pad Thai; theirs while being good had the tails intact which is a pain in the keester. So I would suggest getting the chicken version of the dish.  I have had other various entrées that are equal in quality and flavor. And love trying new dishes when ever I need a change. 

And finally dessert. They feature a plate of sticky rice with fresh fruit which is amazing. It's a bit pricey ringing in at $7 but I think it is worth it for the amount of yummy goodness you get. And it is easily big enough for two people. 

So take a chance and try this place. As I have said it's the best Archies in town. 

Happy Eating,
Jace

Classic Pad Thai today for lunch special!  Great atmosphere. Attentive service. Located right next to the theater deep in the shopping center. Soup came out warm, not as hot (temp) as I like or should be; but flavorful and full of ingredients. The Pad Thai special is touted as their signature dish. Delicious and hit the spot for me.  Sweeter than the other Pad Thai dishes I've had around town; like Pinkow, Lucky Thai, or Le Thai (my favorite for atmosphere-but small and parking sucks.) I got a 6 on the 1 to 10 spicy scale at Archie's. Medium as it should be at 6. You might want to go to an 8 or higher if you want to clear your sinuses. Nice place for lunch. Quick, clean and classy. Good parking.

I am a huge soup fan and I just love their shrimp soup. Very Fresh tasting and I will go back here. I do like other thai places in town which I have reviewed but this one is near my house in Summerlin and is very good.
I cannot say enough good things about Archie's.  I highly recommend this place.  Food is amazing and the service is great

This place is AMAZING, to say the least. 

I've been looking for amazing Thai food, and thanks to some friends, I found it. We ordered about 7 different dishes, and they were ALL delicious.

You will definitely find me here.

I usually love Archies, however tonight was a horrible experience from the time we walked in. The guy at the front was trying to do too many things and wasn't seating people in a timely manner when there were tables available. Then some how my name got crossed off the waiting list and they sat the people who came in after us...he did seat us as soon as I brought the t to his attention but I shouldn't have had to. Then we placed out order and they brought my dinner date the wrong order and they had to wait. And mine got cold. Then they rushed us out with the to go boxes and taking out dishes away, however they took forever to bring the check. It wasn't the good service that we are used to. Hope they get their act together or we won't continue coming here...
I recommend the chicken pad thai, tom ka soup and yellow chicken curry.  The food is authentic and the service is ok!

When we are in the vicinity and feel like Thai, this is our place to go. The food is pretty expectant that of Thai Food. I mean, it isn't anything different than from another authetic Thai establishment...but they're pretty good! They aren't a hole-in-the-wall business, but its ambiance isn't stuck up. I like.its ambiance/decor. Feels kinda homely for some reason.

What makes this place stand out for me is this is the "closest" place for pad prik pow. I swear everytime I hit up a Thai spot that dish is like a rare find on a menu. More so, it isn't some exotic or unique dish. Well anyway, they got it and it's good enough! Beats driving all the way to russell/215, but dang...it's almost there being I'm driving all the way from the North side.

The service is a hit or miss for us. Sometimes they're attentive and other times you're thinking, where the hell...but never have they been rude. Makes a difference, right? It does! Good thing the lack of attentiveness doesn't drag-on like some other places. So nope, no yawning here.

Definitely recommend if you're feeling Thai and you're nearby. You don't gotta jump into your car to drive through the creation for. Kid and stroller friendly!

Enjoy!
Love love love this place!!  its missing a star because they NEVER have mochi  Take it off the menu if youu dont carry it anymore
Must try the Pineapple Fried Rice and Thai Toast! Great prices for their large portions! Great quality food! Super clean! My husband loved the Pad Thai.

This is my favorite thai place, possibly ever. Service is attentive, the food is fantastic and never takes very long to arrive, the price is incredibly reasonable, and the aesthetics are super nice. With the movie theatre right next door, it is the perfect location for a low-key date night. The pad see eau never does me wrong, and as someone who is gluten intolerant, I feel like it is worth saying that I have never had a reaction from their food, either.

Nice environment. Went with friends. Good portion. Vegetable ginger stirfry and Thai salad was good. Padh Thai was a little too sour for me, maybe a bit too much of lemon grass. Pineapple fried rice was good too.

I ended up ordering the chicken Pad Thai which was ok. A bit on the dry side. Also, it would have been nice if the server asked me if I wanted a lunch special or the full entrée. A bit pricey for the quality of food. I'd rather go to Corner Thai Kitchen. Better food and better prices.

The food here is fantastic!! But the service is incredibly slow, they don't seem to communicate between their employees because my party had to frequently deal with the same issues regarding orders, checks, and sluggishness. 

But if you order to go you won't be disappointed!

Archie's has some of the best Thai food in the valley but has the worst take-out. The location is always slammed and living local it's nice to pickup and eat at home but after witnessing through others and first hand, the servers constantly get orders wrong and then you get stuck waiting close to an hour for your food. After this being my 3rd experience, we've decided to order take out some place else.

It was my bf & I's first time trying archi's and it was a horrible experience. We ordered pad Thai and was asked what level we wanted it to be. It was our first time, so I kindly asked what she recommended and all she said was that there's a level of hotness  (well that clearly answers my question).... 
 We got our food after how long, but I got to admit that it was delicious! We ordered pad Thai (level 3) & garlic pepper shrimp. Half way through the garlic pepper, we found a strand of hair and it really just ruined our appetite... 
They were polite, apologized & removed it off the bill so that's a good thing. It coulda been okay if we didn't find the hair in our food. So I give it 2 stars...

One of the best Thai restaurants I've been. We were seated right away on a Saturday evening, and the service was fast, accurate, and very friendly. 
We ordered pad kee mow - amazing! And also the country curry. I would recommend the pad kee mow because the portion is quite big. Mild spicy doesn't taste spicy at all. The country curry wasn't that impressive, unfortunately. It is water based, so it doesn't taste like the traditional coconut based curry. 
The dessert was fantastic. We ordered coconut ice cream with sticky rice. Wow! It was so big and delicious! Definitely do it if you like coconut. 
Will come again next time we are in Vegas!

I've eaten here once before and I think they're pretty good.  We came late in the evening.  I just wish the server would have told us the kitchen was closing.  You know...last call?  We wanted to get dessert but when we asked after another server unceremoniously dropped the check on the table without saying a word, we were told we could not order anything but mochi ice cream.   But the rest of the service was pretty good.  Waters were filled, though I did ask once.  And someone checked on us after we had started eating.  I hope to try Lotus of Siam soon and see how the 2 compare.

Great Thai food!!!  Their curries and pad thai are among the best I have ever had!  Love that you can choose your own spiciness temperature for each dish, which many Thai restaurants don't offer!  They also have great Thai Ice Tea.

Great and convenient for take out!

I used to go to Archi Thai a lot when they were still small, mom & pop kind of place. Their first location at flamingo was the place we go to. I've been to their location at Sahara a few times and has always been disappointed. The food has gotten more expensive, lesser meat, smaller servings and too sweet for my taste. Don't get me wrong they are still busy but service as well is going down the drain. I can go into detail but I don't want to waste any more of my time.

If I could give zero stars I would. We placed a phone order and accidentally called the other location. When my husband went to pick it up the guy refused to make food for him. He said "You called the other location so pick it up there." When my husband asked if he could just place a new order, the guy told him no! They refused to make us food! The other location was way downtown, not just a few blocks away, and it's a simple mistake. We have never experienced this kind of rudeness at a restaurant before. We will never go back!

Wow what an obnoxious manager they have running this place. My daughter ordered Sweet and Sour chicken and normally it's deep fried and their's isn't however the taste of the sauce was horrible so I explained that she wasn't going to be able to eat it and he told me I would still be charged because everyone else in the restaurant was eating the same chicken. In all my years of dining out that has never happened to me. I told him that I wasn't going to eat my food and we walked out! Horrible customer service skills. Their are a lot of great restaurants in town so good luck in the future Archi's.

Awesome service.
Awesome location.
Solid atmosphere.
Excellent food!

Been here for lunch and for dinner and it rocked both times.  All very very good: Red Curry Chicken, Spicy Basil (both Beef and Chicken) and Pad Thai.  Fresh spring rolls are just so-so but thats not because of Archi's.. they are always just so-so anywhere.

Hot rating runs a little hot from my experience... a 4 here is like a 6 at other places but its still super good.

Don't miss this place, the great food or the great service.

Archi's has very good Thai cuisine. Their menu is comprehensive, the restaurant is clean and modern, and the only drawback was the service, which seemed a little disorganized and inattentive.

We tried the Pad Thai and Shrimp Fried Rice on a recent lunch outing.  Both dishes were excellent, full of flavor and seasoned just right. Lunch specials come with soup of the day, a fried Spring roll and a Wanton.  The portions are on the large side, maybe a bit too much food. 

Recommend highly.
Best Thai food in town!! Amazing food and amazing prices.

No. No. No. Service was awful. We were served several dirty dishes. The food was decent, but not worth the awful service! You couldn't pay me to come back and deal with this service. Look out for hidden fees.

Every time we try to go to Archi's, they're closed!!! It's either remodeling, taking extra time off for the holidays, or it happens to be Tuesday and they're closed every Tuesday. How does a business stay open? So annoying!!!

So, I'm pretty much ALWAYS in the neighborhood/general vicinity of this place, it's also been there for close to four years and yet as a lover a Thai food I STILL haven't tried this place? I hit up Buldogi's, Jollibee and Pyaar (R.I.P.) long before I even bothered to check this place out. Could it be living across the street from Basil n' Lime? I really don't know.

So I finally did check the place out. What a wise decision. :)

This may seem a little underwhelming to some because I had Pad Thai. I know, I know, too "Americanized," but that's the very dish that eased me into trying and loving Thai food, and to this day I feel the only way l I can trust a Thai restaurant is if they do Pad Thai right. Anyways, on to how I felt about the Pad Thai. It came out in a HUGE plate, and they don't skimp on the meat (a very good thing since Basil n' Lime is starting to get skimpy with the meat in their Pad Thai). It was fresh, and of course it would be ridiculous to expect Pad Thai to not be greasy at all, but the grease was at a minimum, which was great. No groggy, increased blood pressure feeling afterward. The only issue I had with the pad thai was a few too many glass noodles, they really could have cut back on that (and looking at other plates around the restaurant it seems like they smother EVERYTHING in glass noodles) In addition to the Pad Thai, I also had the Thai spring rolls. These definitely could have used a little more seasoning, but they were fine when dipped in the sweet chili sauce on the side.

The service wasn't very attentive unfortunately, I had to flag people down for pretty much everything, and the fact that the restaurant wasn't even that crowded made it even weirder. The dining floor is very nice though. Small but cozy feeling, not cramped. The ambiance is also in a sort of middle ground between casual and formal. The decor was also very in character (with the exception of the small Budda (not Buddha) statue on the front table....wtf?). The chairs were uncomfortable though, just saying. 

My bill came out to be about $13. At B n' L, it would be almost $16 or $17 for a similar meal, so that's one pro Archi's has over them.

THE FINAL VERDICT:

Pros:
Fresh food.
Reasonably priced.
They didn't screw up the pad thai, a good enough pro in of itself.

Cons:
Iffy service.
Too many glass noodles in everything.
Uncomfortable chairs, so it's probably better to do take-out.

The wtf?:
Is the fat Buddha (appropriately known as Budai) apart of Thai culture at all?

Suggestions:
Be more conservative with the glass noodles. You only need a little bit of them for some crunch in the food, since they don't have much of a flavor on their own. 

Will I return? I'm really not sure.
One of my favorite Thai restaurants in town. If you have a chance, visit during lunch. Their specials are extremely reasonable and delicious!

This place serve some very decent Thai food and we eat here on a fairly regular basis. Never had a complaint here, prices are affordable and service is more than acceptable. But the construction in the shopping complex, where this particular Archi's is located, is something that you should try to avoid, at least until after it's completed.

Spicy Basil, always amazing. Their tofu was cooked well, which is hard to come by and they didn't skimp on the zucchini (huge plus).  I like really spicy thai food, but my friend ordered this dish mild and it was still super delicious with a good amount of spice.

Archi's is a Las Vegas Thai chain with 3 locations, and I must admit that a recent obsession with Thai Noodle had caused me to forget about how much I do enjoy some curry and noodles at Archi's, particularly at my neighborhood location. 

When we first moved to town, Archi's was our go to spot for Thai. The food can be great, which I will get to later, but I think what distinguishes Archi's from most restaurants in Las Vegas is their interior. They have done a brilliant job transforming a strip mall space into a warm, clean and welcoming space. There is a coherent sense of design, which puts me at ease for some reason. Maybe it just makes me feel like Archi has a good handle on things. 

And he does! After being a little Thai adventurous and eating all around town, I can confidently say that when the food is good it is really good. Granted, they do suffer from inconsistency from time to time, and their spice scale baffles me. A 3 can be mind-blowingly hot despite the fact that the scale supposedly goes to 10. Consider yourself warned. 

Despite that, when I want curry or Pad Kee Mow or a very respectable eggplant dish, I am happy to visit Archi's. The tofu in their stir-fry and noodle dishes is not the most flavorful, but I was obsessed with their Pad Kee Mow for at least a month. I became a little frustrated when the vegetable selection kept changing. How hard is it to give a girl a solid helping of real vegetables (baby corn does not count) with her noodles? However, on my last visit, I told the waitress "lots of yummy vegetables please", and apparently that is the secret phrase to unlock garden delight because I got mega-veggies. Splendid!

The service has always been no-water-glass-empty amazing when I have visited. Food comes out quickly and hot. Servers are always nice.

I was teetering between a 3 and a 4 for Archi's, but Archi, I am slapping a 4 on your establishment because although the food is a little inconsistent, I really really appreciate the atmosphere, cleanliness and service, and when the curry stars align, the food is definitely fan worthy.

Love this place so much. One of three restaurants that I crave on a multi-weekly basis. Everything is always fresh, service is superior, and ambiance is true to the classic Thai restaurant. 

Drinks are easy. They usually either crack open a young Thai coconut with a straw, or pour me an ice cold glass of Thai tea, depending on my mood. If I'm hungry enough for an appetizer, I go with the veggie egg rolls, and sometimes a cucumber salad with peanut sauce. For dinner, it is almost exclusively a beef salad with a request for lean beef (no, I don't like chewing on fat) and my absolute favorite, PANANG CURRY with chicken beast. I'm literally drooling while writing this. Panang curry is so creamy and spicy you'll want to order extra curry sauce, which I usually do. I've tried other things, that were admittedly delicious, but I can't not order panang. 

If you're lucky enough to come in often, the hostesses/waitresses will likely remember you. This always adds to the experience, when they welcome me back and ask if I'd like my regular order. Nothing beats that feeling. 

Amazing service, amazing food. Get here.

I've dined here probably 15-20 times since my coworkers love this place, it's close to work, and they have good lunch specials. I'm happy with everything I've ordered except the fresh spring rolls with Chinese sausage. I would not order that again.

Their lunch specials all come with their soup of the day, a fried spring roll, and a fried wonton. I've finished their lunch specials except for their Pad Thai. It's a huge serving, enough for two or three people. I like to eat Pad Thai with jalapeños for an extra spicy kick. Spicy basil with ground beef or fried tofu is another favorite of mine.

Their non-lunch choices- Pad Prik King, Rad Nar, Panang curry, red curry are wonderful choices too.

Tip-They are closed on Tuesdays which I thought was a weird day to be closed.

If I have a Thai food craving and don't feel like driving to Lotus of Siam, Archi's satisfies the craving. You're not gonna find out of this world dishes, but the kind of dishes that have become staples of Thai food found in America. Service is always prompt and attentive and it's speedy when you're ordering takeout.

Their spice levels are out of this world! Make sure you get the lowest level of spice if you're like me and can't take spicy foods. If you love spice, this is the place for you! My friends ordered 7's and I spent the entire time sniffling and sweating. Let's just say it was a very uncomfortable meal for me.

The tom yum kah with flat noodle was nothing special. It was loaded with mushrooms and noodles. I wish there was more chicken in it. The spicy garlic chicken was vey garlicky and served atop a bed of cabbage and broccoli. Healthy dish that came with a side of rice. The Panang curry was probably my favorite dish here. Definitely a must try! Lastly, the pad see ew was also yummy but nothing memorable.

I would give this 5 starts but my order was wrong last time.  I asked for an 8 and 2 and I got a 10 and 8.  Needless to say, I couldn't eat it and lunch time was over I had to get something else.

On the positive side, their portions are nice sized and the food is very flavorful.  I used to go to the one on Flamingo and Rainbow and stopped going there because I found a hair in my food.
Other than that I like this place.

I never knew I'd love eating catfish orr curry. I guess archi's has given me a reason to. It's called chu-chi here and it has both curry and catfish in one dish. I get it at level 7 cus I love the spices from Thai cuisine. We always have celebrations here or sometimes just roll deep for no reason. I'd say it's prolly the last great thing standing at village square, besides the movie theater next door.

They brought us water, the place  is NOT busy! Why can't someone take our order? I don't get it, they put us in the corner now no service! What a dump! On new years eve  when it's not busy customer service does not exist here!
The food here is very good, one of my favorite Thai restaurant. Service is excellent. Foods came quick. I had pad thai spicy level 10, was not disappointed!

This would be a 5 star if for the food alone.  It would be a 4 star if the only issue was the fact that the rice portion that comes with the red curry was too small. It became a three because the service we had wasn't very good. I admit I will give it another try in the future as I think every place can have an off night for some patrons.
Nice place to eat tasty food.service is good enough.prices are affordable.staff is fast and kind.will definitely come back to have a lunch or dinner.my review is not big enough.will update it later.

I love their curry which is all I ever get there. They have a few different kinds but they are all delicious! I usually come before going to the movies next door. It's not usually too busy and you don't really have to wait. They are a little slow with the service though. Worth checking out.
I just had dinner on Sahara location great place good food can't wait for next time ...
Ok so I am from LA.  This is not LA thai...  It is very good.  We had the Tom Yum soup with shrimp...  Very nice.  We had the red curry.  Very nice...  Best I have had in Vegas...

Archie's is one of the best Thai restaurants around Vegas. I always order the yellow curry with chicken and the pad Thai noodles. Both dishes are excellent. I don't usually order too many other items on the menu, but I have tried a few other dishes that were also very good. If you want to try a good Thai place, try Archie's. You won't be disappointed.

You can't beat great Thai food, and Archi's has just that. When we first moved here it was one of the first places we ventured to and has remained a favorite. Not only is it great tasting food, the service is also wonderful. They are very welcoming, attentive and the food comes out pretty quickly. I love their pan nang curry. I tend to stick to that dish while my husband ventures out and loves everything he gets. This is a great little, friendly place for quality food. They are closed on Tuesdays....which is when I crave them the most!
solid penang curry. i ordered to go and it was delicious. had some leftovers and re-heated two days later, and it was still solid.

Nice place, plenty of space and clean.  Service was very quick and professional, drinks were kept filled.  Food was very fresh and tasty, came out fast and steaming hot.  Spice was good, but perhaps a little on the mild side when I ordered one dish at a "9", but I love spicy food.  We will definitely return.

My mouth is watering just thinking about this place. Best thai food around!! I've enjoyed every single meal I've ever eaten here, and I continue to crave it after I've left. The service isn't outstanding, but the food is the best part and will keep you coming back for more! You won't be disappointed if you love some good thai food. Highly recommend.

This place is great! 

The food is fantastic, good menu selection and everything is always consistently tasty. The Pad See Ew, Pad Kapow, Pla Moo and Masaman Curry are all great choices. The waitstaff is cordial (enough), but if you go for dinner... be prepared to be a little patient, as you may have to wait a bit to get serviced. Although in my opinion, it's a good thing when a restaurant is busy like this. One of my fave spots for Thai!!

Delicious!

Their walls are covered in awards, and every last one is well deserved. I'd post a picture of my food, but I ate it too fast.

Highly recommend the pad see ew. I've had it at a lot of Thai restaurants, and theirs is the best. Lots of egg, wide noodles, and plenty of flavor!
